results.description:
This is a group for women  30-40 years old   interested in meeting new girlfriends to brunch , travel and get pampered with. 

To build an authentic sisterhood I will be very selective when accepting requests. There will also be a  limit on the number of Sistah-Hive members in this group. 

I do not want to exclude anyone , however I believe that having a smaller number of members will make getting to know each  more authentic and most importantly easier and form  real friendships.


Sistah- Hive  events will include

• Brunch

• Dinner and Movie night

• Broadway show's 

• Wine Tasting

• Cooking Classes 

• Museum trips 

• Spa days 

• Girls Vacations

• Caribbean Weekend Getaways 

• Day trips 

• Volunteer day 

• Dance classes and more !!!


I will be scouting locations and trying to find fabulous and affordable events for our Sistah- Hive Adventures. 

Before you join this group , please keep in mind that. This group is a commitment and we do expect you to participate as and attend meet ups as much as possible  


RSVP Etiquette 

If you RSVP for an event  please be sure to attend. We understand that life happens If your rsvp changes. Please change the RSVP to No to allow another member to participate.

 3 No shows without changing your RSVP. Will result in immediate removal of your membership for this group.

I can't wait to start planning fabulous events for us !

 For now, I've scheduled a handful of smallish events so that we can get to know each other, and also due to venue sizes. 

 I'll add in some larger ones later!  Please feel free to suggest ideas and start online discussions/polls. If there's a filled wait list, I may expand our reservation if the situation allows.

I look forward to meeting  you soon !
results.name: Sistah Hive

We will eat / dine at mostly mid priced restaurants, the focus will be on restaurants that have outdoor seating, and are locally owned. I will be looking for dinner specials on seafood when possible, nothing too fancy.

You are welcome to enjoy anything on the menu!

Let's meet and enjoy seafood!

results.description:
There is an abundance of information these days about yoga, meditation, inner well-being and balanced living. People everywhere are searching for ways to improve their lives, reduce stress and find peace and happiness. For this, we don’t need elaborate philosophies, abstract intellectual theories or complicated routines that are impossible to sustain. We need something simple, easy and effective; something we can do every day in the comfort of our own homes. 

Heartfulness Meditation is a simple, practical technique that you can use alongside to any other form of yoga, meditation or spiritual practice. In a few minutes, you will learn how to truly relax and feel the lightness and joy of your true nature. You don’t need to know how to meditate or to believe in a particular system or philosophy. The Heartfulness technique shows us to gently turn our attention towards our heart and experience that inner presence for ourselves. 

This meetup serves New York City and nearby areas. We are a global not-for-profit organization dedicated to uplifting the hearts of the communities we serve. All teaching and methods are free. Please visit our international site: www.heartfulness.org
results.name: Heartfulness Guided Meditation Meetup -  NYC

results.description:
This is a group for anyone interested in UX/UI Design, Product Design, Web and Mobile Development and doing good using their skills. It's related to the Prototyping User Experiences Meetup (http://www.meetup.com/Prototyping-User-Experiences-NYC-Me...) I started that with the goal to "teach, mentor and share knowledge" with fellow prototypers.

I started the "Hackers 4 Good" group to meet other people that want to use their professional skills to give back to their communities – and the world at large – by hacking real world problems, and creating and building solutions that can make a difference.

The hackathons format will be approximately this:

• A chosen non-profit organization will be invited to provide a problem that they'd like help with – where they think that design and technology can help.

• During the 2-4 four hours hackathons the teams will be able to put together a basic idea and prototype of their solution

• The winning team, and others interested might continue working on the project, IF  they like the cause/project, other people might be able to join as well.

• IF we find sponsors, we'd love to see these solutions come to life and make a real difference.

All skills levels are welcome. Looking forward to meeting everyone! 

Feel free to reach out or suggest charities or sponsors! :)

Thank you,
Francesco
results.name: Hackers 4 Good: Creating Great Experiences for Everyone

topics.name: Career, executive, placement, job search, resume

results.description: Looking for a new career? Tired of clicking "submit" to hundreds of online applications and not receiving any responses? Do the pixels on your computer screen seem to be moving because you've been staring at it for so long? This group is designed for those that are unemployed and looking for a career or those that are looking to transition careers. Family and friends can provide only so much support, but I found the most comfort in people who were in the same situation as myself. The goal is to provide you with free professional development advice and strategy to help you in your career search. Whether you're a new graduate looking for your first career or a tenured professional looking to transition, all are welcome. Additionally, if you are in a neighboring area (Hoboken), feel free to attend. I believe that anyone who joins this group has something to offer, you may not know it yet. There are so many online resources to help with your job search that it can be overwhelming. I would like to put it out there that there are multiple opinions on how to handle job searching and these are just my own. Find what works best for you and try new avenues if what you're doing isn't working. I am starting this group because I want to help give others more opportunities to succeed in their job search. I know firsthand that unemployment/career transition can leave you feeling a little lost and in need of some direction. All suggestions are welcome - interview prep, resume critique, professional dress, rolling over your 401k from a previous employer without penalty or taxes, etc. I realize that working in a team is better than working alone. If you are a professional that is looking to contribute back to your community, please let me know and we can meetup and find ways to make this group more effective. Looking forward to meeting you!
results.name: Jersey City Career Transition Meetup

results.description: "Angels can fly because they take themselves lightly." ~G. K. Chesterton. Alan Watts took himself lightly. He stated that he wanted to make one thing absolutely clear. He had nothing to sell and that he was an entertainer who just wanted you to enjoy a point of view that he enjoyed. His laughter was as important as his outlook. He was a gifted storyteller who's incredible intellect was enveloped with a flair for the dramatic. results.description:
Welcome to the New York chapter of The Nonfiction Authors Association, a national community with over 10,000 experienced and aspiring writers of business, self-development, health, reference, memoir and other nonfiction books. Our NFAA local chapters focus on the business side of writing, publishing and promoting nonfiction books. Meeting agendas typically include a guest speaker focused on a topic related to the publishing industry, introductions by all attendees, and a signature mastermind session where three to five attendees are selected to share a publishing-related challenge or question and receive feedback from the group.

No matter where you are on your publishing journey, whether you’re just getting started or you’ve already authored dozens of books, whether you’re self-published or traditionally published, our mission is to help make your journey easier.

NFAA local chapter attendees are not required to be members of the Nonfiction Authors Association, however, we do invite you to join us online with a Basic membership (free) or Authority membership ($19/month).

Authority members receive many added benefits including:

*Free Attendance at all local, in-person NFAA chapter meetings.
*Live access to our twice-monthly teleseminars with industry professionals, plus recordings.
*Exclusive checklists, templates and worksheets archived weekly.
*Participation in our active members-only forum on LinkedIn.
*Monthly members-only publishing Q&A calls.
*Weekly marketing tips sent via email.
*Special discounts with our sponsor partners (Office Depot, PRNewire, Profnet and more).
*Special discounts off our annual Nonfiction Writers Conference and year-round Nonfiction Book Awards.

***For additional information and to join the Nonfiction Authors Association, visit us here: http://nonfictionauthorsassociation.com/join/.

NOTE: If you represent an organization or group that is in need of a speaker, please browse our member directory or contact our group leader for a personal recommendation.
results.name: New York – Nonfiction Authors Association

results.description:
We are writers and aspiring writers. We are bloggers and wannabe bloggers. We meet regularly to interact with serious and not-so serious bloggers.

And the Meetup serves Hoboken NJ, Jersey City, New York City.

We also have author book readings, hold informal writing sessions and discussions, and support each others' writing aspirations. We strive to become better writers and bloggers.

We will often feature expert speakers on writing, blogging, and web-related issues. There will be special emphasis on optimizing web traffic and blog monetization.

Our topics of discussion include:

1) writing better and faster

2) overcoming writer's block and procrastination

3) driving traffic to your blog

4) how to gain traction, credibility, and legitimacy as a blogger

5) how to grow your audience

6) monetizing your blog

7) how to get "published" - on-line and off-line

and more!

We welcome veteran bloggers, newbies and those of you who want to learn more about the wonderful world of writing and blogging.

We are a supportive, non-competitive community focused on helping each other improve and grow as writers and bloggers. We are here to help each other achieve their writing goals -- be they grand and lofty, or practical and realistic.

We are a community composed of talented, creative people located in the Mile Square City -- Hoboken NJ.

results.description:
If truthful and meaningful relationships matter to you, then this Meetup is for you.

Whether among friends, lovers, or family members, we value intimacy itself as a personal and spiritual growth practice.

Our main medium for this is "Circling", which is a meditative form of communication and relating and one of the most powerful transformational practices in existence (No, I'm not exaggerating on that!). We also utilize a wide variety of relating games and connection exercises to discover more about ourselves and each other, not to mention have a ton of fun doing so!

Come join us and see what all the hype is about. We look forward to connecting with you further!

For more information on Circling, visit any of the following pages:
http://integralcenter.org/what-is-circling/
http://circlinginstitute.com/circling/what-is-circling/
http://circlingeurope.com/about/
results.name: New Jersey Circling & Authentic Relating

results.description: This is an off-shoot of the "20/30 something book club". (You don't have to be a member of both.) This is for the hardcore reader who feels he or she wants to tackle some major works. We'll be reading books that have at least one edition that is at least around 500 pages, and can be twice as long. We'll usually alternate between fiction and non-fiction to provide variety. Since the books we read can crack skulls with their bulk, we'll get together once every 2 months to give us enough time to git 'em done. If you're not intimidated, if you want to test your mettle, if you want to flex those biblio-biceps of yours, then step right up and join us Big Apple biblio-bruisers for the bookish fun you've always craved and deserve. It's time to kick ass and chew gum, and leave others in awe of our literary fortitude!
results.name: 20/30 Something LongReads Book Club

results.description: This is a weekly indoor tennis group that takes place from September-April (sometimes May).  It is held on Sunday's from 4-6PM.  The venue we play at is Brunswick Hills Racquet Club in East Brunswick, NJ.  It is 2 hours of competitive tennis which involves 4 different match ups. Match ups are done in random.  This league you do not play with a set partner.  The cost each week is $25.00, which includes play, balls, and food afterwards.  This league is not for beginners, the average USTA Ranking of the players is 3.0-4.0. If you are unsure of what rank you are, you can read descriptions on each level at USTA.com.  Besides mixed doubles sometimes we mix in some men's, women's, or 3-1 doubles.  After the season is over I may post some outdoor tennis get togethers, if anyone has a date, venue, and time I would be happy to post it. You will be asked to contribute a one time yearly fee of $3.00 starting in September to cover some of the meetup costs.  This group has a maximum of 50 players.  I usually ask a few entry questions since space is so limited.
results.name: Brunswick Hills Mixed Doubles League

I provide individual services (i.e. makeovers, weddings, birthdays, 1-on-1 makeup lessons etc.), private group events (in the comfort of your own home) and interactive group "ladies night" makeup sessions open to the public. results.description: Spend a writing weekend in the writer's town. Distinctions among genres, and between genre and literary fiction, have become irrelevant. Once, Kurt Vonnegut angrily denied that he wrote science fiction; now, the New Yorker gives it an entire issue. And Henry James scorned historical fiction as "essentially impossible," which would surprise Hilary Mantel. Our program will address craft issues common to fiction in all its forms, whether mainstream or cross-genre. Our first day is a master class led by award-winning authors whose work explores the boundaries of literary, speculative, and historical fiction. On the next, you'll discuss your own and fellow writers' work in small groups. Our faculty are nationally known writers as well as experienced and accessible teachers. John Crowley's Little, Big won the World Fantasy Award and was nominated for the American Book Award. He has also received the Award in Literature from the American Academy of Arts and Letters. He has taught creative writing at Yale since 1993. Louis Bayard is the author of Roosevelt's Beast and Mr. Timothy and teaches at George Washington University. He also wrote the New York Times' weekly recap of Downtown Abbey. Both are veteran faculty of the Yale Writers' Conference.
results.name: Company of Writers Fiction Workshop April 8-10

Meet industry experts and expand your capabilities. Introduced by Mark Gold the author of "5 Rules to Hacking Networking Events", this private group is focused on rapidly growing business networking capabilities with insight and introductions. Members will be personally introduced to high-profile decision makers within various industries and invited to experience in-depth networking workshops. The group's mission is to give members a systematic framework on how to build business relationships with high-level decision makers and invite members to exclusive high-level networking events.  Events include VC Summits, Investor Summits, mHealth Summits, High-Tech conferences, Marketing Conferences, Career Panels, Social Media Workshops, Personal Branding Workshops, Networking Workshops, and Special Events across NYC including at Microsoft, United Nations, and Google. 

Mark Gold is the CMO of TOTO Global Ventures, and a Personal Brand Manager with clients from Bravo, Shark Tank, and Wall Street. Mark Gold is a high-level networking expert and esteemed event producer who co-organized Marketing Week NYC 2015, Entrepreneurship Week 2016, NYC's first Digital Influencer Travel Panel with the Government of Guatemala, and a 2 day High-Level Networking Workshop with Google. Mark was named "Super-Connector" by Social Magazine and considered a marketing thought-leader who's been a featured keynote speaker at Microsoft, New York Bar Association, Long Island University and Merrill Lynch.

results.description:
The Schiller Institute is starting a chorus in Brooklyn, to uplift Brooklyn and the nation!

As the poet Friedrich Schiller identified, "It is through Beauty that One Achieves Freedom."  At the end of 2014, with a real potential for social chaos breaking out in New York City in the wake of the rulings around the tragic death of Eric Garner, the Schiller Institute determined to begin a series of community choruses throughout the city as a means of using beauty and powerful ideas to allow New Yorkers to rise above the ugliness and violence.

No auditions are required, and all voice types are welcome. A focus on classical music, American patriotic songs, spirituals, and lieder.

www.facebook.com/schillerchorusnyc

Schiller Institute choruses in Manhattan, Boston, Virginia teamed up last December to perform a wonderful concert in Brooklyn a the beautiful Sacred Hearts of Jesus and Mary/ St. Stephens Roman Catholic Church.

http://schillerinstitute.org/highlite/2015/1219-nyc-messiah/main.html


All of our rehearsals and performances are held at the Verdi Scientific tuning of A=432 Hz.

The Schiller Institute was founded over 30 years ago by Helga Zepp-LaRouche, wife of statesman Lyndon LaRouche, with a mission to draw from the most beautiful ideas mankind has to offer, in order to uplift mankind. Mrs. LaRouche, known affectionately in China as the "Silk Road Lady," has been instrumental in the development of what was announced in 2014 as China's policy of Silk Road Development, One Belt One Road.

For more information, call Margaret Greenspan 646-509-5451 or email newyorkchorus@schillerinstitute.org
results.name: Brooklyn Live Music Meetup: Schiller Institute Chorus

If you live in the city or Hoboken, as many that spend the summer in this town are, there is mass transit that can take you back and forth so many spend SUnday night and do the direct morning commute into work. results.description:
This book club is for Christians in New York City who approach faith with curiosity and are willing to explore, doubt, question, and uncover the unexpected.

You'll probably enjoy this group if you identify as Progressive, a Mystic, Post-Evangelical, Postmodern, or part of the Emergent movement. You are welcome, regardless of where you fit on the theological spectrum. We'll read a new book each month and get together to discuss it.

Format: 

- Each book club event will be limited to 10 people (feel free to host your own if one is full!)
- Some months the book will be curated. Other months, Members will vote between two options.
- Please be respectful of each other's point of view. Listen as much as you speak!
- Send a message to Josh if you have any questions or want to host your own Meetup to discuss the book.

If you are interested in hosting or know of a great meeting space, please contact me. - Josh

-------------------

Books We'll Read & Discuss (Subject to Change):

• April: Learning to Walk in the Dark by Barbara Brown Taylor 

• May: Immortal Diamond by Richard Rohr 

• June: Searching for Sunday by Rachel Held Evans OR A Hidden Wholeness by Parker Palmer 

• July: Help, Thanks, Wow by Anne Lamott OR Accidental Saints by Naida Bolz-Weber 

• August: The Sin of Certainty by Peter Enns

• September: The Divine Magician by Peter Rollins 

• October: A Farewell to Mars by Brian Zahnd OR How to Be Here by Rob Bell

• November: The Ragamuffin Gospel by Brennan Manning OR Gifts of the Dark Wood by Eric Elnes

• December: Sacred Rhythms by Ruth Haley Barton

• January: Take This Bread by Sara Miles 

• February: The Book of Forgiving by Desmond Tutu OR No Man Is an Island by Thomas Merton

-------------------

Things to Keep in Mind...

1. Read the Book. If you're going to attend, please be sure you read the book. Reflect on what the author had to say and how it speaks (or doesn't speak) to your own faith journey.

2. Commit to Show Up If You RSVP YES. If you commit to show up, please show up. Emergencies sometimes arise. We get that. If you cannot make it, please change your RSVP so someone else can attend.

3. Allow For Others to Contribute: Be mindful of how much you're talking versus the rest of the group. If you find yourself a lot, take a breath and pause. Silence is okay. Give others the room to contribute.

4. Don't Pretend to Know It All. Everyone's faith journey is personal and particular to them. Our discussions are meant to be explorations, not debates. Disagreement is of course okay, but if you're dead-set on debating or proving you're "right", perhaps check out a different group.

5. Vote: This book club is a mixture of curated reads, as well as allowing Members to vote. On the months we're voting between two different options, please be sure to give your input! A message will be sent with a link to voting.

6. Feel Free to Host: If a scheduled Meetup doesn't work for you, feel free to find a location and time to host your own Meetup throughout the month to discuss the book. Shoot Josh a message and he can add it to the list.

Also, please use a photo of your face for your member profile.
results.name: Curious Faith: A Book Club for Thoughtful Christians

results.description:
Welcome to the NYC Working Moms Networking Group!

Working together to build collaborative network for working moms who are entrepreneurs, freelancers, independent contractors and consultants.

Doesn’t matter if we work virtually or solo, we are accomplished working moms who know how to make things happen and get things done! But sometimes alternative working arrangements present their own unique challenges of feeling isolated, not creative, and longing to work with a collaborative team. 

The mission of the NYC Working Moms Networking Group is to connect with like-minded women facing similar obstacles, meet interest women who have unique perspectives, skills, and talents. Along the way, contribute to a collaborative team that helps everyone grow her business or career.

Each month we host business networking events to introduce you to other working moms who are entrepreneurs, freelancers, independent contractors, or consultants.

Membership to our group is free. If you’d like to sponsor us or purchase a vendor table at one of our events, please contact us.

results.description:
BIZ TALK Team Networking Workshop

Welcome!  Biz Talk is an extension of your marketing: it is , effective and professional. Biz Talk is here to help improve your business or encourage you to start your business. 

This is a lot to read and very important. Please take the time to read it.

The tomorrow is HERE and it has become the NOW!

Biz Talk Value

The group will work towards helping you effectively network; learn how to maximize the contacts you make to best work for you; and offer workshops designed for small groups. 

Our Sponsor

BIZ TALK is sponsored by Biz Consulting Hub, INC., a business consulting firm helping businesses build relationships and maximize their market outreach. Led by a an excellent leadership team, Maria, and John, members are taught networking skills and coached to work collaboratively for lead generation and customer aquistion.  

Why BizTalk?

Unlike most networking groups, Biz Talk is not for members to sell their service to one another. Members work and produce viable leads to one another, learn about each others service or products, and share their experiences with others. Your business will be promoted from the time you walk in the door to the next time you attend.  

Membership

All members that join are tentatively approved.

To remain in the group, members must attend a BIZ TALK Team Networking Workshop (free), which are held at least once a month.  Members will be shown: the methodology and the best practices to network; how to build relationships with businesses whom you have nothing in common with; how to build your business through "hot leads"; and the policies and and expectations in the group.

Membership is FREE for the first 3 MONTHS. No obligation! This will give members the opportunity to decide if this group is for them.

After 3 months we trust you will see the value of the your team's efforts. That's right, being in this group is like having your own team working for you.   A minute here a minute there adds up to an enormous powerful sales  3 months are yours!  Use them and see for yourself if our fees justify joining.  We know they will.

The annual fee is $250 per business with one representative and an additional annual fee of $75 per registered representative. It comes to approximately $21 per month or $5 a week,  less than $1 a day!

Free groups are filled with people coming and going with people wanting to pitch to you and sell their service or product.  You won't find that in Biz Talk! We meet to help sell you! 

Become a charter member and save 50%! Here's how:

•  Enroll the day you attend the BIZ TALK Team Networking Workshop.  

• Must enroll before June 1, 2016 (don't wait for the last BIZ TALK Team Networking Workshop, attendance is limited and seats may not be available)

• Limited to the first 100 members. 

Save $125! As a charter member you pay only $125 for an annual membership plus 3 months! That's less than  $8.50 per month.

Biz Talk - NYC is looking for quality enriched members that add value to the group. With that comes the commitment from the leadership of this group to work for the member's best interest.  This is not a hobby, but a fully functional network of business people meeting for the purpose of expanding their business and increase their revenue.  

Best Regards, 

Maria & John
results.name: Biz Talk - NYC

results.description:
We are people suffering from anxiety and/or illness who meet at a comfortable location to talk and find support from each other.

Hi, my name is Karen and this is a new Meetup group. I would like to create a support group for those of you out there who might be going through some anxiety, health problems, or both (they often come hand-in-hand), and are having trouble finding support among the people you know. It can be tough finding the right emotional support and/or advice you need that will help you through the difficult times. And it might be nice to connect with others who are going through something similar. Lets get together, share stories, and offer patience and kindness to each other. Lets create a safe place to talk, give and receive support, and maybe laugh too :) I'd love to have Meetups in relaxing settings where we can comfortably get to know each other and also enjoy our surroundings in peace. I hope you consider joining. This is a new adventure for me too.

* I have a basic Meetup account, so this group can only have max 50 members. Check back next time if we hit our max, a spot might open up!

results.description:
Being a newcomer in NYC is more overwhelming than you expected? Solely moving to a new culture is already a challenging process: struggles with the language, the herculean task of finding an apartment, learning your way around the city, making new friends and so on. But as you might have already noticed, there’re many other challenges involved in adjusting to a new cultural environment - especially one so diverse and multi-layered as we encounter in NYC. No matter how broad-minded or global soul we are, dealing with new words, gestures, facial expressions, customs and norms might often make us feel frustrated, anxious and like a fish out of water trying to make sense of all the nuances of this new cultural environment. 

In this group we’ll learn to cope with this process by sharing our impressions and emotions together with other international newcomers. The organisers will also provide tools, strategies and tips that they’ve been developing through their personal experiences and professional background in the field of intercultural studies. Doesn’t matter if you’re fresh off the boat or have been here for 1 month, 6 months, 1 year, 3 years ... all kinds of newcomer’s are welcome!
results.name: NYC for International Newcomers

results.description: This group is organized by my husband, Dennis Hoop, and I (Iva Hoop aka iLookFresh) so we can share our passion for outdoor fitness, feeling energized and healthy. Dennis is a Holistic Health and Fitness Coach, as well as a Crossfit Level 1 trainer. He is HUGE into sports, fitness, healthy eating, preventing diseases, gut health and an incredible inspiration to our family, friends, his clients and mostly myself. I grew up passionate about dancing, painting, being outdoors in nature but for over 10 years, I have been challenged with ADHD problems and smoking addiction, which caused me to steer away form myself and from what I love. Upon meeting Dennis, I had the strong desire to change but I always felt like I was alone in my journey. Now, after almost 2 years I have been enjoying a much fresher side of life, mainly because I discovered that unhealthy habits, loneliness and depression can be best cured through movement, through being outdoors, connecting with nature and mainly through sharing this experience with other people. I love Dennis' approach to exercise and fitness, not because he is my husband, but because he is extremely creative in making workouts fun, playful, unique in such a way that while you sweat all the 'bad' stuff, you gain some great laughs with your team mates. This is something I feel like is missing in the "gym" world and wanted to bring it out to you too, because I know it helps, because I know you will love it too and because you will want to start moving not because you have to but because you want to. We began this type of group training, while living in New Zealand. It felt so refreshing that we decided to bring it to you too, here in New York, so you can also experience a Fresh New Day. The Hoops are excited to meet you!

results.description:
The Focus
Whether you're stuck on page one or want to hone your craft, this workshop is meant for you. We'll discuss the craft of writing and learn how to write killer openings that draw readers in, create compelling characters, build suspenseful plotlines, and create endings that satisfy reader expectations.

Although all are welcome, women and people of color are especially encouraged to join; I believe it's imperative to get more diverse and untold stories out into the world.

Member Expectations
Members agree to submit stories for critique and prepare critiques in advance for other stories. Most meetups will be limited to 8-12 people to keep workshops focused and let members participate more fully. 

I've designed this workshop around a mix of improv fundamentals to loosen up the creative mind, and the Iowa Writers Workshop (via Sackett Street) for maximum critical feedback. Each meetup will include a writing exercise/prompt and critique unless described otherwise.

Etc
This meetup meets in a private home with a dog, so beware allergy sufferers!
results.name: Brooklyn Writers Workshop

results.description:
Welcome to the future! 

This is a group for anyone interested in Ethereum, decentralized automous organizations / coorperatives and decentralized applications (dapps) built on the Ethereum smart contract platform. Whether you need support building a dapp on top of the Ethereum platform or simply want to discuss the possibilities of a token enabled membership driven DAOS or the cryptoeconomy come join us! We are especially interested in high value adding, disruptive decentralized dapp alternatives to incumbents in massive industries.


For the first time in the history of the internet, internet communities can collaborate globally without restriction or permission to virtually work towards a common goal, like managing the direction and development of decentralized application virtually, using immutable decentralized software built on the Ethereum platform. Such software general design enable parameter based decentralized proposal tabling and voting.  The systems and social structures formed by such decentralized global colaboration are known as DAOS. Daos can organize for any number of initiatives including non-profit and profit based dapp services. 


DAOS: Get a primer on DAO'S here :

• Decentralized autonomous organizations 

• Decentralized autonomous organization terminology

• Decentralized automous organizations practical example code


DAPPS:

Exploring alternative disruptive decentralized dapp ideas disrupting traditional legacy industries

Dapps are built using simple Javascript (front -end) and solidity a simple Ethereum blockchain VM based smart contract language

• Intro to dapps

• Example Dapps

• Front end javascript api (web3js) 

• Backend Solidity Language

• Advance smart contract system architecture list

Superdao : 

Superdao is a two - tier consensus based, community token-driven membership DAO system for managing multiple disruptive Dapps and protecting against hostile take overs and sybill attacks. The model is also available to anyone for use by using its factory to generate a copy system for management of another set of dapps.


http://www.superdao.io
results.name: Ethereum DAO, DAPP & Superdao Collaborators

results.description: New York Times bestseller, “When Breath Becomes Air”, by Paul Kalanithi chronicles the author’s transformation from a naïve medical student “possessed by the question, given that all organisms die, of what makes a virtuous and meaningful life”? Paul, an aspiring neurosurgeon at Stanford working in the brain, that most critical place for human identity, becomes a patient and a new father confronting his own mortality. We’ll explore what makes life worth living in the face of death. What do we do when the future, no longer a ladder toward our goals in life, flattens out into a present that now sees an ending? Are we allowing the fear of death to rob us of being fully alive? These are some of the questions that we’ll be addressing over four Wednesday evenings as we discuss how we or our loved ones can “go on”, or in popular parlance “keep on keeping on”, particularly when facing a terminal illness prognosis. We invite you to bring your personal insights, your questions, even your doubts and fears as we take hope from the author as he quotes Samuel Beckett’s famous 7 words: “I can’t go on. I’ll go on.”
results.name: "When Breath Becomes Air": A Groupthink Dialogue MeetUp

results.description:
Hello! Thank you for visiting my new meet-up page.

I'm a freelance Japanese language teacher & translator from Tokyo, currently living in NYC. I've been teaching ESL & Japanese Language for about 6 years in my life, and lately I've decided to organize new meet-up group lectures!

My teaching style is essentially giving a lot of informations and options to my students, so they can build up their own identity in the language.  Especially Japanese has a tremendous variation of expressions, so it's very important to understand both Japanese culture and your own background to merge them into one solid identity. - I believe that learning second language is so beneficial not only for career options, but also for human development perspective. Me, as a non-native English speaker of 3.5 years of speaking experience, I've experience a huge development of my own characteristic and identity along the process of learning English.

In this meet-up, I'm planning to have Japanese language classes for all different levels, Calligraphy classes, and some casual meet-up activities to explore Japanese restaurants and places!

Beginner: hiragana & katakana exercises, essential-practical vocabulary & grammar - Genki I

Intermediate: Some professional-business terms of expressions & completing grammar - Genki II

Advanced: grammar and vocabulary reviews, using short articles & stories for reading, writing responses, discussion

Please feel free to message me for any requests & questions.

Also every 4 meet-up attendance will get you $10 discount for my private lessons! The details for private lessons are here: https://www.facebook.com/notes/japanese-lan...
results.name: Japanese Language & Calligraphy Lectures 🇯🇵

results.description:
Every 66 seconds, someone is diagnosed with Alzheimer's. By the year 2030, twenty percent of all people aged 65 and over will be diagnosed with the disease, a disease that produces pain not only for patients but also for their loved ones. Those who die from the disease often face a long journey before passing as there are seven main stages to Alzheimer's before death . In the final stage, individuals lose the ability to respond to their environment, carry on a conversation and, eventually, control movement.


A few years ago, I wrote the book “Dancing into the Fog” a true story about my personal journey into Alzheimer’s. Now, I am preparing to write a new book, "A Journey out of Alzheimer's Darkness," as I have accomplished something that—as far as I know no-one else has ever done before! I dare not say I have beaten it… I dare not say I don’t have the disease any longer. From everything I have studied, I don’t believe that is how Alzheimer’s works. I will, and can, say I am well ahead of the game and have notable improvement in every sense which, again, has never before happened!


My success has been noted by all those around me. I have to pinch myself from time to time as I am still walking on a cloud. I actually did it, and I am starting to put my life back in order, which leads me to help others with this disabling disease.


My goal is to help educate and coach people with Alzheimer’s and other memory loss diseases along with their caretakers with a step-by-step process of living a fulfilled, satisfying life and gaining the memory improvements that I myself have achieved. I will be touching on diet, exercise, supplements, and life style.
results.name: Help Alzheimer's Disease Meetup Group

results.description:
Welcome to the Official Google Developer Group (New York City)

We are a technology-based organization that is completely run by a community of volunteer organizers. Because of this we are always looking for volunteer help in running events, and are open to community suggestions and contributions in terms of speakers, event venues and sponsorships. Just talk to one of the organizers and we'll be happy to work with you.


About GDG NYC

We are software developers, designers, educators and students with an interest in learning about emergent technologies in areas including (but not limited to) mobile, web, wearables, cloud computing, education technology, data sciences and smart homes. 

Our events can vary from featured Tech Talks (40 mins or more) to Short Talks (20 mins), Lightning Talks (5 mins) as well as focused events (workshops, hackathons, study jams).

Our talks may feature Google technology (e.g., Chrome, Android, AngularJS, Google Glass, Android Wear, Polymer, Google Compute Engine ..) but also extends to competitive technologies, products and platforms. 

Our primary goal is to create actionable networking, collaboration and entrepreneurial connections for technology enthusiasts in the New York City.


History

The founding organizers of this meetup are long-time members of the Google Developer Group community. Prior to March 2016, this meetup existed as "GDG New York" and we organized several successful events around Android, Cloud, Polymer, VR, Wearables and Chrome under that banner.  

In March 2016, we made a collective decision to rebrand and launch "GDG NYC" as the official Google Developer Group New York City chapter and look forward to working with both the Google Developer advocates and with the greater New York City developer community, to make this city a showcase for next-generation technologies. Join us!


Disclosure

We are not run by Google. However, we are a listed Google Developers community and count on them as one of our sponsors (specifically as venue hosts and for signature events like Study Jams). Any opinions and activities here are our own and do not reflect that of Google (the corporation).
results.name: GDG NYC

We are the New Comic All-Stars and we specialize in 3 things: chewing gum, drinking tequila, and telling jokes.  The only thing we run out of is gum.  Show up to a show with a pack of Bubblicious Watermelon and get a round on me. 

Most of our shows are FREE.  We want no money.  We want the privilege of your presence.  So come on out, grab a drink and enjoy your night with us.  Where we can, we avoid any drink minimums - however some clubs do require 1 or 2 drinks to be purchased.  If that's the case and you have an issue with that, let me know and I'll help you out. 

We do throw MEGA shows at some pretty BIG venues.  Places such as Webster Hall, The Cutting Room, The Metropolitan Room, The Trocadero Theatre, and the Taj Mahal.  At these places, we have to charge a cover to help pay for the staff and the room - usually under 20 bucks.  Again, if there is ever an issue just message me and I'll see what I can do.  

Our goal is simple.  We want to perform and entertain you.  We strive to pick the BEST venues for you to see us at and we juggle our lineups to provide you with the BEST stand-up comedians that we are sure to bring you tears of laughter. 

If there is ever a request, question, or even a suggestion please let us know!

results.description:
Interested in learning more about Brooklyn Education Innovation Network? Head over to our full website at http://beinbrooklyn.org/

About Us

We can’t solve problems by using the same kind of thinking we used when we created them.

-Albert Einstein


What happens when you have a booming college town located in the heart of New York City’s third largest business district – and one of its strongest hubs for technology and innovation? The opportunities are endless. The Brooklyn Education Innovation Network (BE.IN) works tirelessly to create connections and cooperation among member institutions, students, and Brooklyn businesses.

Mission

Founded in 2014 by the Downtown Brooklyn Partnership, with support from the City of New York, BE.IN’s mission is to foster cooperation among member institutions to broaden and enrich academic programs, encourage economies of scale through shared services, expand and encourage community service activities, and fuel economic growth by being a magnet to draw the best students and faculty to study, explore, live, intern, and work in Brooklyn.

BE.IN also works to create a sense of community among the over 11,000 faculty and staff of our ten member organizations, connect the area’s 66,000 college students to internships and jobs, and help local businesses source the best talent to fill internship and graduate spots right in their own backyard – Brooklyn. Find out more about Brooklyn’s College Town.
results.name: Brooklyn Education Innovation Network

results.description: We are a group of people who are aware that we are on a spiritual journey, and we enjoy spending time with other like-minded people. The energy that is created when we share our thoughts and experiences is fulfilling, reassuring, and the main reason why we are drawn to these types of gatherings. The group meets to discuss the concepts presented in the CWG (“Conversations With God”) books written by Neale Donald Walsch. Neale's books have been on the NY Times best sellers list for years, have been translated into numerous languages, and have been sold all around the world. His writing style allows his readers to understand and engage in concepts that can sometimes be difficult or intimidating to confront. He handles the big issues such as the meaning of life, where we go when we die, and what God is really all about. He has a great sense of humor about himself and life, which makes reading his books both enjoyable and relatable. We enjoy an open-minded and inviting atmosphere where we discuss the ways that CWG has touched our lives. We discuss ways to bring those concepts into our daily lives, what we have struggled with, and how we feel we can spread the message. There is a workbook we use that is a companion to the CWG book. It serves as a guide for incorporating these principles in all aspects of our lives by using exercises and assignments that require us to think critically, and honestly about our experiences. This Meetup is open to anyone who feels the desire to engage in these conversations and to continue (or start) transformation in their lives. If you have not read the CWG books yet, please feel welcome to join us anyway. It is not a requirement of the Meetup, and we will all be happy to share our experiences with you. We will also be reading from the series during our meetings. Purchasing the book(s) is not a requirement, but if you would like to, it is available on Amazon, or www.cwg.org. On the website you will also find information about Neale and all the different resources that are available to you. In a world that is ever changing, and in a time of great need for our planet, we look forward to transforming our lives and the world around us.
results.name: Montville CWG Social Meetup

This group is for you if you...

Group Rules

- Please do not join if you think this is a good idea - but really don't go salsa dancing regularly

- Please don't RSVP and then don't show - someone may have gone through a lot to make it and you are not there. You will be removed from the group.

results.description:
The purpose of this Meetup is to create and empower the conscious community in New York City by providing affordable and free sacred arts and spiritual programming and gatherings at our communal space in Greenpoint, Brooklyn. We want to grow our community by bringing together creative and spiritually aligned individuals who want to serve the local community by sharing their gifts, talents, practices, and wisdom. Our programming revolves around self-expression, spiritual practice, and communal inclusion. We are open to all people who wish to empower themselves and those around them in creating a better world. 

Sacred Arts Research Foundation (SARF) is a nonprofit, nonpartisan organization whose mission is to provide support for the sacred arts through the provision of funds, space and resources for artists. Our base is at The Ark, a space in Brooklyn, NY where many of our activities occur. SARF seeks to support those who create in the realms of visual arts, music, crafting, performance and healing arts. SARF makes its space (The Ark) and its promotional network available for this purpose. SARF is a community organization which was bred out of the Golden Drum community in Brooklyn, NY. Under the guidance of community leader and Taino elder, Maestro Manuel Rufino, we have come together to create a home for the Sacred Arts in America. Our goal is to create a sustainable organization supported by government funding, grants, donations and income generating activities. High-quality art is a community asset and for this reason we give our time, money and energy to this cause. Please visit our sister site at www.goldendrum.org
results.name: Sacred Arts Research Foundation Events (Brooklyn, NY)

results.description:
Build with Code hosts free weekly JavaScript and Software Engineering workshops, lectures and pair-programming sessions. 

Welcome! The reason people who only watch programming videos don't become programmers is because they're not programming. Come join other aspiring engineers and start building! In JavaScript the Hard Parts, we cover callbacks, higher-order functions (functional programming with JavaScript), object-oriented programming with JavaScript, closure, scope and execution context.

 JavaScript the Hard Parts has been our most popular workshop in LA, and now Codesmith CEO Will Sentance is bringing it to New York City. 

Price: Always free 

About Codesmith: Codesmith teaches full stack software engineering in JavaScript through a 12 week immersive program. We teach computer science, object-oriented JavaScript, React, Angular, Node, distributed systems and mobile development so our grads can secure mid-to-senior level software engineering positions or launch their own ventures 

Apply to the program at codesmith.io/apply. For further questions email admissions@codesmith.io 

---

JavaScript the Hard Parts is a free JavaScript class in San Francisco, Los Angeles, and New York City designed to learn intermediate and advanced JavaScript - including callbacks, higher order functions (like how to understand map, reduce, filter and foreach), closure, object-oriented programming in JavaScript and other topics 

In Codesmith Information sessions, attendees meet with current students and graduates to discuss what it's like to attend Codesmith, what characteristics create the best coding bootcamp in the US, how to get into Codesmith and how to succeed in the Codesmith interview

results.description:
Improve your performance in any sport or exercise by applying Tai Chi Principles of Perfect Skeletal Alignment to your workout or fitness regimen. Yang Family Tai Chi Master Robert Morningstar has studied and taught Tai Chi Ch'uan, Shaolin Kung Fu and Ch'i Gung for more than 44 years. 

TC Master Morningstar and has distilled the essence of Tai Chi, applying its principles to improve performance and efficiency in various sports, including running (sprinting or jogging), soccer (Tai Chi Soccer Drills), and gymnastic yoga. He has invented several Tai Chi Sports, including Thunderball (a hyperdimensional & superfast martial art sport played with 3-5 balls at the basic level and 5, 6 and 7 balls at advanced levels (imagine being able to catch 3 balls with one hand in a single motion). 

Tai Chi Sports Master Morningstar has developed Tai Chi Disk Sports, such as:

1. Thunderball, which teaches rapid eye-hand coordination and spatial awareness, 

2. Single/Double and Triple Disk Frisbee, which improve agility, stamina and eye-hand coordination (imagine catching 2 frisbees in one sweep with a single hand). 

3. Tai Chi Soccer Dance Drills, which teach quick footwork, excellent balance and agile foot and leg movements using a soccer ball as the object of concentration.

4. Zen Soccer Drills, which teach the player to anticipate intuitively where the ball is going to go BEFORE the opponent kicks its.

Tai Chi Master Morningstar is an avid multi-discipline sportsman and athlete who can impart the most important principles of Tai Chi in a few simple, easy lessons to help you improve your performance in any sport, or help you recover from illness or injury in a relaxed and natural way using Tai Ch'i Gung methods derived from over 40 years of practice.

Private lessons, Tai Chi physical therapy and counseling for Stress Management are also available by appointment.  

Call Robert Morningstar for a free phone consultation at 212-496-1472 or email: -> robert.morningstar@gmail.com.

results.description:
The Seconda Brigata Julia was constituted on August 10th 1944 by Giuseppe Molinari (Birra), an officer of the Alpini, the oldest active mountain infantry in the world. Upon his return from the Eastern Front, Birra armed and organized the first groups of partisans on the mountains near Pontremoli and Borgotaro, in Northern Italy, to fight against fascism and the nazi occupation. 

The son of a farmer and an elementary school teacher, my father was only 17 when he joined the Seconda Julia, his nom de guerre was 'Sparviero'.  A voice for freedom and democracy throughout his life, he wrote about his experience and believed that we must remember and learn from the past if we don't want to repeat the horrors of the past.

As a child I grew up listening not to fairy tales, but to the real stories of men and women with unforgettable mythical names ... Vampa, Fadiga, Pablo, Glory, Patirai, Prete Volante, Lima etc. With the anniversary of the liberation of Europe coming up, I'm reminded of my father and would like to connect with WW2 partisans, as well as adult children and grandchildren of European partisans (friends are welcome).

The purpose of this Meetup is to bring together people with a personal interest in this page of history, exchange stories and anecdotes, share photographs and memorabilia, read articles and books.
results.name: Brooklyn Seconda Brigata Julia Meetup

results.description:
There is an interesting paradox relating to word-of-mouth recommendations and technology: the more technology we have available to us, the more we value personal recommendations. Brands (both new and old) now place even more focus on partnerships and personal recommendations as they are a cost-effective and incredibly valuable way to drive new business and expand brand awareness. When two like-minded companies partner together, it creates a win-win situation for both and the value is greater than the sum of its parts. 1+1=3.

As Deborah Sweeney of Forbes magazine wrote: “When businesses have great partners to refer customers to that are similarly related to the same industry, customers recognize this and go the partner for their needs because they trust the company that referred them on. This in turn helps provide both businesses with new clients and customers and increases strong word of mouth and company loyalty.”
results.name: New York Business Partnership Meetup: 1+1=3

results.description:
Always wanted to take an acting class but felt too self-conscious, intimidated or shy? this is the class for you!!! ITS FUN, CREATIVE, NON JUDGEMENTAL, DEVELOPEMENTAL. NO EXPERIENCE NEEDED

BELOW IS MY BIO

Zenobia Shroff has been an actress for thirty two years, she got her start in Mumbai under the mentor-ship of the legendary Pearl Padamsee. With Padamsee’s encouragement, she came to study acting at New York’s Circle in the Square theatre school. Soon after she honed her craft at the off Broadway theatre Castillo, where she played several and diverse roles such as Nora in Ibsen’s ‘ A Dolls house’ to German avant-gardist Heiner Muller.

She also performed in Mario Frattis “Erotic adventures in Venice” at the famed La Mama and Milan Kunderas “Jacques and his master”.

She has taught drama and movement extensively throughout the new York city area, primarily for inner city and low income children. She continues to tutor privately

Most recently she was in Sooni Taraporevalas “Little Zizou”, presented by Mira Nair. For that role she was nominated as best actress at the Mahindra Indo-American Arts Council film festival in 2008. Nest she was seen  ‘When Harry tries to Marry’, an independent film. Most recently she was in her first Bollywood film,"Ek main aur ekk tu" with Kareena Kapoor and Imran Khan.

Zenobia is an accomplished Bharat Natyam dancer and writes and performs sketch comedy. Her one woman show,"Exotic Observations'', a humorous look at being a south Asian in New York City is available for performance.Her writing can be viewed on this website and www.theajnabee.com

Her acting reel and clips from ''ExoticObservations'' can be seen on this website and also on

www.youtube.com/zrshroff

REVIEWS

But the scene-stealer of the film is Zenobia Shroff she offers myriad shades to the role with her husband, with Zizou, with her daughter or her mother she's spectacular. MUMBAI MID-DAY

Of the cast, Zenobia Shroff is outstanding as the harrowed mother, wife and daughter. At no time during her entire time on screen does one get the sense that her character Roxanne is not a real person. REDIFF.COM

Zenobia Shroff is fabulous as the Parsi mother—she’s another one who seems like she’s unaware of the presence of a camera LIVEMINT.COM AND THE WALLSTREET JOURNAL
results.name: ACTING FOR NON ACTORS

results.description:
Do you want all young learners to have access to creative learning experiences?
Do you want to explore how to include computing education in K–12 classroom?
Do you want to be a part of a supportive community of educators?

If so, we welcome you to join our Scratch Educator Meetup community!

Want to know more about what Scratch Educator Meetup is all about?

Scratch: a free tool for exploring computational creativity by programming interactive media (like stories, games, animations, and simulations) and sharing those creations with others online, used by millions of people all around the world

Scratch Educator: a teacher who wants to support computational creativity in the classroom and beyond, helping learners—from elementary school to high school, across curricular areas and settings—imagine, program, and share with Scratch

Scratch Educator Meetup: a gathering of Scratch Educators who want to learn with and from each other, sharing their ideas and strategies for supporting computational creativity in all its forms 

Sound intriguing? We hope to see you here online or in person at an upcoming meetup!

This group is part of the Scratch Educator Meetups Network, which is a project of the Creative Computing Lab at the Harvard Graduate School of Education. This project has been made possible through the generous support of the Scratch Foundation.
results.name: New York Scratch Educator Meetup

results.description:
Our group is currently closed to new members as we have a maximum of 50 members based on our membership through Meetup.com. We are sorry that we cannot accept you now, but hope that we can at some point in the future!!

Do you like to R.E.A.D...Read, Eat And Drink? Then this is the book club for you! We will meet during the last week of each month at a location in Northern Monmouth County to discuss the book of the month, enjoy some beverages and food and just have a good time with other local ladies of all ages!

Please note this club is only for the ladies :) 

Some info about us... 

• We are not a serious study book group, we are a casual, informal group where our conversations are guided by our books and members! We just ask everyone to respect each other’s opinions so we all feel encouraged to have open and honest dialogue at our gatherings, and that we listen to one another as we speak :) We do sometimes use discussion questions to guide our conversation, but we promise there are no quizzes on the book!

• Our policy is to only allow new members who have a picture posted. This will help you find us at a location, help us find you and make it easier for everyone to get to know one another!

• After 6 weeks of site inactivity (not visiting our site, at least RSVPing "No"), you will be removed from our member roster. This does not limit you from joining again, but our membership plan through Meetup.com is only designed to have a maximum of 50 members. We know that life gets busy, and you cannot always check our site...but, to be fair, we usually have 8-10 people a week asking to get into our group, so we want to make sure that our current members are actually active and at least checking the site at least once over 6 weeks. 

• No Show Policy: Members will be removed from the group after 2 RSVP no-shows. We completely understand plans change and last minute emergencies arise. To ensure you are not marked as a no show, please leave a comment to the group, send a message privately, or change your RSVP any time before the event. This is extremely important as we will be having our monthly gatherings at local restaurants…the RSVP number will determine how large of a table we will need. 

• While we do not charge an annual membership fee, we appreciate the kind donations from our membership which help to offset the Meetup dues. 

• We want you to come and participate even if you did not read the book, as we know life can get in the way... just be prepared for spoiler alerts!
results.name: R.E.A.D (Read Eat And Drink): A Book Club for Women

For example, perhaps one month we read The Great Gatsby. On our second "activities" meeting, we might dress up like this era of the 1920s and all have dinner at Gatsby's by the Bay. Or perhaps we read The Hunger Games. We might decide to get our Katniss Everdeen on and spend an afternoon taking archery lessons. Of course, participation of everything we do is voluntary and is the decision of each member. Our primary focus will be sharing in the reading of a novel each month and the supplementary activities will be discussed and decided upon as a group. Even if you don't want to take part in themed activities, just come out and join us once a month to discuss books and make friends!


The point of this group is to connect with others, share in the love of reading, and bond with a great group of women who want to try new things, have fun, and live fully. We invite everyone to join us in creating something incredible!

results.description:
Christopher Hitchens - Amazing, witty, scathing and dignified until the very end. Hitch was a first class mind by any measure; intelligent, brutally honest, brave and compassionate.
'Hitchslap' is an endearing term of verbal take downs that with grace and humor, an opponent's argument is obliterated. 

He is missed. 


So what better way to remember the Hitchslap than a (cheapish) brunch with vigorous discussion and levity.

The group is open to anyone who doesn't take themselves too seriously, and is willing to ponder the art of the 'hitchslap' in a spirit of good will. Anyone who has an interest in thinking for themselves is welcome! All ages welcome!

Twice a month, we will meet for Sunday morning brunch in Manhattan and perhaps throw around a few classic 'hitchslaps' for a laugh.

If you are not familiar with the 'Hitchslap', come along anyway and meet new people in a relaxed atmosphere.
results.name: 'Hitchslap' Brunch NYC

results.description:
The Ubiquitous Voice Society is a group of doers and want-to-be-doers meeting around the world, working on the concepts, applications and devices, where voice is the predominant or integral interaction point. Ubiquitous Voice Society focuses on the most natural, and native of user interfaces - Voice - which will play a more significant role in how people interact with technology, and with the increasingly connected intelligence around them. 

This group is for designers, technologist, makers, and those aspiring to create, to think and talk about the next generation of technology, and the potential that it has to contribute to our society, personal well being, entertainment, and general life experience. This group is New York City Metro based, but is part of a coordinated network focused on "smart" technology, natural and integrated experiences between technology and people as a whole. 

Siri pushed a major milestone in user engagement with intelligent speech interfaces, opening the door for natural, augmented reality / interaction, showing speech recognition and natural language interaction in a new light to consumers, in a way only researchers had been experiencing for years. Google Voice and Microsoft's Cortana have expanded on that milestone, putting speech technology on track to become a more pervasive part of our daily lives. Supported by a host of devices beyond smartphones, the emergence of smart, in home devices; and wearables, expand the potential and design challenges in front of our industry. We have also seen the emergence of new, and even more compelling form factors, such as Ivee, Martian Watches, Jibo, XOWi, and most recently the Amazon Echo - perhaps Canary and Nest in the future - that will make the arrival of ubiquitous voice possible. 

Ubiquitous Voice Society shares a goal to exchange information, learn from each other, network, workshop, and engage in activities that promote the mission of making voice a meaningful, life enhancing interface.
results.name: Ubiquitous Voice Society New York

results.description:
This game is for people who want to be physically active by playing competitive, yet fun and exciting softball games. We are looking for players who have positive attitudes, collaborate well with others and people who are laid back in the sense that their main priority is to enjoy the game and not to complain about trivial issues. If you are a carefree and upbeat player who wants to meet new and interesting people, and have some laughs in the process, you will have a great time here. Play hard and try to win but no arguing allowed.

General rules of the game:

No called balls/strikes.  You get three swings to put the ball into play.

No taking leads.

Sliding is allowed but be careful.  Be mindful of who is covering the base if you choose to slide.

Game is capped at 24 to ensure those that sign up will get a lot of playing time and at-bats.

Unless someone wants to play C the entire game, the position will be rotated amongst all team members equally.

Unless someone wants to pitch the entire game, the position will be rotated amongst all team members equally.

If 24 people sign up, the defense will be rotated so that each team member plays 4 innings in the field for each 1 they sit.

Fee structure:

First game free.

$5 per person per game

$25 for the season.

Schedule:

The field is reserved nearly every Saturday from 4/2-8/27 (21 dates)

No game:  4/23 - Passover  

No game:  TBD - Various concerts/philharmonic close the Great Lawn on random weekends (central park's calendar web page is TERRIBLE)

I'll email/post in the event of inclement weather potentially impacting the game.  Alternatively you can call the hotline at 212-628-1036 x111

results.description:
This is a group for people who want to go enjoy New York more than as just a photo opportunity. New Yorkers tend to rush from place to place, often not noticing the beautiful, quirky, out-of-place things they pass by. We usually don’t know that there are fascinating stories all around us. Join licensed New York City tour guides, Deb, Laurie and Alan, as they explore New York’s parks, architecture, historical sites and neighborhoods so that together we can see the city as if for the very first time. While we were preparing to get our tour guide licenses, we discovered many fascinating facts about the city, many gems hidden in plain sight, many stories about the movers and shakers and the little guys that nobody remembers. We're bubbling over with excitement, and we want to share our discoveries with other people who love this great city. We also know that the opportunities for learning about and appreciating our city are endless. Meet up with us, sometimes on an interesting street corner, sometimes for a walk, sometimes to visit an out-of-the-way museum or historic area, as we look at the city with fresh eyes. We want to learn more about the city, we love sharing what we know, and we believe that together it will be fun and a great way to meet other urban explorers. 

The group's leaders are all licensed tour guides hoping to build a following. Accordingly, our Meetups will be free for the foreseeable future and are meant to give us an opportunity to practice new tours and visit sites throughout the city with other people who love exploring New York.  We'll ask you to sign up for our free newsletter and to like us on Facebook, but that will be completely voluntary. Each Meetup member will be responsible for their own incidental costs, such as admission fees, food, or transportation. If a member liked the tour or trip and felt our services were helpful, a tip would be welcomed.

To learn more about us you can visit our website at http://www.takeawalknewyork.com/home.html  Our Meetup tours will only be announced through Meetup and will not appear on our Take a Walk New York calendar.
results.name: NYC explorers meetup

Peace & Good health

results.description:
Who Are We? Awesome.

ASAM (pronounced, "awesome") is not just your average meetup group. ASAM is intended to be a member-run group, not one of those top-down groups where one organizer decides everything. In other words, the group will have only as many activities as you, the members, collectively suggest and organize. The more you pitch in, the more recreation choices you will have.

We have found that the most amazing, AWESOME, fun, easy-going people are attracted to the name, "Awesomely Mediocre." People who have a sense of humor about themselves are just more fun to be around, plain and simple!

Got any Examples of Activities or Sports I Can Attend and/or Organize? Yup.

How about fitness-oriented activities such as volleyball, dodge-ball, badminton, lacrosse, ultimate frisbee, walking, pickle ball/pickleball, hiking, flag football, soccer, golf, softball, baseball, frolf, bowling, martial arts, walking, running (I like high intensity interval training m'self!), cycling, kickball, ping-pong, corn hole, climbing, swimming, gym sessions, confidence courses, tennis, dancing, pool, boxing, yoga, capture the flag, etc.,

OR, purely recreational activities such as beer bar socials, barbeques, scavenger hunts, geocaching, picnics, cooking classes, movies, camping, scrap-booking, knitting, meditation, theater shows, wine tasting, board game nights, video game tournaments, etc. Can YOU think of anything else?

It's Too Hard! How Would I Even Go About Organizing a Meetup? Learn more here: http://www.meetup.com/Awesomely-Mediocre-Coed-Sports-Sacr... Then contact me and tell me what and why you'd like to organize. Organizer titles looks great on resumes too!

All five boroughs --- Brooklyn, Manhattan, Bronx, Queens, and Staten Island are welcome to join!
results.name: Activities and Sports for the Awesomely Mediocre - NYC

But we excuse for using mixing Japanese & English sometime :-)

こんにちは！！このミートアップグループでは、日本の歴史や文化を改めて見直し、日本人としての誇りを取り戻し、またそこから未来に向けての指針を培っていける場となればと思っています。一応、毎回、どなたかに日本の歴史や文化についてお話ししていただき、その後、お茶やお菓子等で、みなさんと和気藹々と交流を深める集いとしたいと思っていますので、よろしくお願いします！！名前はとても固いですが、それとは違って、全く固くない場としたいと思っていますので、どうぞお気軽にご参加下さい！！

Meetings will start with a specific topic to be covered for the first hour. Afterwards there will be informal sharing sessions between parents. There are many support groups for bereaved parents as Compassionate Friends, the COPE Foundation (they have specific support groups), Bereaved Parents USA, etc., but very few support groups specifically for loss of an only child or all children.

A singer songwriter? Awesome. Electronic musician using Apple Logic, Ableton, GarageBand, ProTools, or Reason to record and/or remix? Perfect. Slam poet rhyming to beats? Fantastic.

Let's do this!

results.description:
STEAM education is crucial for K-12 students as they are learning and beginning to forge a path for their adult lives. STEAM (Science, Technology, Engineering, Arts, Math) incorporates the 4 C’s – collaboration, communication, critical thinking and creativity, integral skills that are in high demand and are necessary to thrive in the 21st century workplace.

This Group will serve as a resource for educators and parents, of K-12 students, as well as researchers, professors, business professionals and others who are dedicated to making sure our students thrive in the 21st Century Workplace. Our Meetups will feature a variety of topics and speakers, demonstrations and sharing of ideas. We hope you will join us for lively discussions, practical information and brainstorming on how STEAM education can prepare our students for the workforce of the future.

This Meetup Group is hosted by Hofstra Continuing Education and LaunchPad Huntington.
results.name: STEAM Education: Inspiring Future Innovators

results.description:
This group is for anyone interested in improving their English conversational skills. The meetup group is designed to help members practice speaking in English with other students and native speakers.

Who should join: Anyone who is interested in improving their English conversational skills and make new friends in NYC is welcome to join. It doesn't matter how old you are, where you are from, or how well you speak English. Everyone is welcome, and we will support one another to speak English better.

Why should members join: There are many English schools out there where students can learn the English grammar and composition. But what many ESL students want is an opportunity to practice speaking English more and better. Members will have that opportunity in the group. We offer 10 sessions of English speaking lessons in a semester at a studio in Midtown Manhattan. The instructor will help members to improve their English conversational skills.

What can members expect out of the group: The group will meet once a week on Wednesday nights from 7 PM to 8 PM. Members can stick around 15 to 20 minutes after class to hang out and ask questions. Even though the group will meet at a studio that is rented by the hour, all classes will be free of charge.

The group will also have outing events, such as going to famous restaurants in NYC, Broadway musicals, sporting events, and etc. Members will be able to make new friends from all over the world. Please message me if you have questions.
results.name: NYC English Speaking Meetup

results.description:
It is scientifically proven that people who laugh and have fun live longer. The older you get the harder it seems to meet women with similar interests who can be your "Girlfriends". So let's live Ladies! This is a social group for motivated, fun, positive women who want to build friendships and socialize with other like-minded women. The group will intentionally be small in order to cultivate personal and meaningful friendships. The emphasis is quality not quantity. ;-)

This group is all about doing the things we love and meeting new girlfriends in the process!

 **Reasons to Join the Group**:

1. If you are looking to meet women with a solid foundation who have similar interests (in the mid-30s to mid-40s age range).

2. If you like to socialize, try new things and meet people in the meantime.

3. If you are looking to meet real women minus the drama.

4. If you love to have fun!

5. If you have a zeal for life, an enthusiastic spirit, outgoing or shy, this group is for you.

Activities include, but are not limited to:

~ Taste bud Excitement: Group Dinners/Wine Tasting/Happy Hours/Girl’s Night Out/Brunch

~ The Great Outdoors: Walks/Fairs & Festivals/Shopping Days

 ~ Look Great: Fitness Excursions/Spa Day/Pampering

The possibilities are endless... your suggestions are important so "PLEASE" add all details in the suggestion box.

**If you'd like to join this group, we do have a few things we require **

1) A photo of yourself is required to join. It makes it very difficult to find each other at gatherings if there is no photo posted.

2) If you would like to plan an event, please contact the organizer of this group and she would love to discuss the details with you. However, please note the purpose of this group is to cultivate friendships and is not a target for soliciting goods or services through events. Anyone requesting to join the group with a 'business and/or marketing intent' will be denied (i.e., home-based business parties such as Tupperware, Candles, Jewelry, etc.). Thanks for understanding!

 3) Please RSVP 'Yes' for an event only if you're sure you're able to attend. Space may be limited and therefore some events fill up quickly. To that end, if you have (2) or more 'No Shows' (meaning you RSVP'd 'Yes' but never 'Confirmed' for the event or showed up), you will automatically be removed to the 'Wait List' for future events. In addition, please do not RSVP 'Yes' but add a comment such as 'more of a maybe'. If you do, your RSVP will be removed, or you too will be moved to the wait list.

4) Usually about (1) week prior to the event an email will be sent to those who RSVP'd "Yes" requesting that you 'Confirm' for that event. Please take a moment at that time to go to the event page, click on 'Update' (located next to the green GOING button) and add in comments section: 'Confirmed'. This step is important as most times an accurate headcount is needed to reserve a table. If you are unable to attend once that email is sent out, please kindly change your RSVP to 'Not Going'; it frees up space for another member that may currently be on the 'Waiting List' for that event.

 5) Inactive members will be removed.

6) Lastly, show up!! Don't be shy, come out, introduce yourself and most of all....have FUN!!!
results.name: Staten Island Ladies Friendship & Social Circle

results.description: Looking to get your TV script to the next level? NYC TV Writing Intensive Workshop is a group that will pair together like-minded aspiring TV writers into small, 5-person workshop groups that will meet weekly. Ideally, each group will have a like-minded focus. This is a very intensive, right-to-the-point group that will follow a three month syllabus (1st month: pitch, story beats, outline, Act 1, 2nd month: 1/2 of the script finished, 3rd month: final script finished) with deadlines, page counts, readings from screenwriting books and scripts, and edits. Each week the members will send each other their pages a couple before meet-up night, they'll print them out and read them on their own time, writing detailed edits, notes, and a write-up about the pages, as well as working on their own material. We'll then meet weekly to discuss with each other and do some voluntary readings of the scripts. This is for the most dedicated, hard-working, and passionate aspiring TV writers who have the time and availability to dedicate themselves to this group.
results.name: NYC TV Writing Intensive Workshop

If you've ever admired dancers for their bodies or the way they, here's your chance to learn some new moves and get that dancer's body. We do fitness based dance sessions, which means you do not have to "know how to dance" to participate. We teach dance moves and combinations that are easy to learn so that you can focus on having fun. All the music and dances used will be urban, pop and Afro-Caribbean based styles, such as hip hop, dancehall, pop, soca and more. If you're looking to learn how to dance the Waltz or the Foxtrot, this is not the group for you. If you're looking for something that will allow you to have fun, learn some new moves and help you get fit, you found the right place. Just in time to get that summer body. Come join us and let's jam!

results.description:
" Dancing is sometimes all the therapy you need"
Welcome to Our Belly Dance classes! 
WHERE? 540 Durie ave, Closter NJ 07624 (Ventura Dance Center)
WHEN? Every Saturday at 10 a.m. $15 per person
Belly dance as many experts say, is the oldest form of dance, having roots in all ancient cultures. It takes many different forms depending on the country and region, both in costume and dance style. New styles have evolved in western culture as its popularity has spread globally.
Belly dance is a low-impact, weight-bearing exercise, osteoporosis preventive and is suitable for all ages and fitness level. The dance is enjoyed and performed by women and men as well.
The dance often focuses upon isolating different parts of the body, moving them independently in sensuous patterns, weaving together the entire body. The body benefits from undulating moves that lengthen the spinal column and strengthen the abdominal muscles in a gentle way.
results.name: Closter Belly Dance Classes/ Belly Dancing Bergen County
