results.description:
The group will review and discuss a Future Technology Predictions and Scenarios. How far will technology advance in 20, 30, even 50 years from now? How will it affect our lives? Here are some technologies and scenarios predicted by science fiction writers, futurists, technology experts, me and you. 

ARTIFICIAL INTELLIGENCE 

Intelligent machines The Singularity Computers that predict the future Original music from software/machines Computer mediators that resolve legal disputes Machines/robots given rights Planet sized A.I. machine I-bots, or AIs that exist only on the Internet Artificial animal intelligence Artificial Intelligence used as classroom assistants Ai sports (robots playing football) 

BIOTECH/MEDICINE 

Extended/eternal life Synthetic life Repairing/manipulating DNA Organ replacement Growing organs Designer babies Designer bodies Personalized drugs Gene therapy/manipulation Biostasis - Cryogenic sleep Human cloning Virtual/robot medicine Instant pain relief Bionic implants to allow for extreme strength Morphing of the human body Age reversal Creation of organisms Synthetic organs Enhanced senses Alteration of our bodies in superhuman ways Bionic limbs Never have to sleep or eat Use genes of other animals to implant in humans Artificial immune system Computer generated life - design a tree, generate a seed Creation of new animal and plant species by genetic manipulation Human/animal waste elimination Gene manipulation to change eye and hair color at the salon Cloning of extinct species A capsule that can be swallowed which will cure most diseases Instant hair color changer Cloning machines Genetically altered humans that can photosynthesize A new sense discovered, example eyes see a new type of wave, ears hear a type of wave.....another useful sense for humans Food as designer medicine 

BRAIN 

Download your memories/brain Complete digital record of your life Mind/emotion control devices Dream control devices Brain enhancement implants - memory, telepathy Transfer of information into the visual cortex or subconscious mind Artificial telekenesis - an implant to alter physical things with your mind. Brain Transplants Tapping into unused parts of the brain Download training experience, e.g., someone could be able to fly a jet or guide a submarine Memory/personality manipulation Increasingly bulging and Grays-shaped heads 

CHEMISTRY 

Replication and/or transformation of one chemical element to another Super lubricant Artificial spider silk Matter Reformation. (trash into food or plastic) Catoms, or claytronic atoms. Programmable matter 

CITY 

Megacities/entire world is one city Moving/floating/underwater cities Underground cities Cities/houses could be one huge organism which can repair itself Self-constructing buildings Anti-seismic buildings Vertical (skyscraper) farms Interactive Tourism 

INFORMATION 

Instant information Virtual presence Wireless everything One small mobile device does everything Virtual reality Internet-connection implant All media (movies, tv shows, etc.) on-demand Holographic messages Language translator implants Telepathy Phone implant Cyberspace telekinesis 

COMPUTERS

results.description:
The arch nemesis of "Casual Fridays." When you're new school and everyday is casual, we're your excuse. Dust off that suit or pull out that dress, and mark your calendar for the first Friday of every month! We pick a location in New York City, meetup, socialize, and have fun. Join us for a great night, the city awaits.


History

We started back in April of 2011 as a small, but dedicated group of professionals working at Sony Music on the Global Digital team. We created assets, built websites, and ran the online stores for some of the biggest names in Entertainment. Neither the Tech industry nor the Music industry require proper business attire for the 9 - 5, so we decided to take it upon ourselves to have a good reason to class it up once a month. Every month since we have held an event on the first Friday of the month and have grown to encompass people from a wide range of professions: doctors, lawyers, brokers, televangelists... the list goes on.

results.description:
Are you motivated, disciplined, ambitious, dedicated, and actively working toward your personal and professional goals? If not, do you want to be? If so, then this is the meet up for you. Many people say "you are what you eat" but I say "you are what you CONSUME". If you want to change your life, your outlook, your everyday experience and ultimately your destiny, first change your mindset. Make no mistake: every action starts in the mind first and if you put junk in you will get junk out! This Book Club is for everyone who wants to be someone. Regardless if you are a self-help junkie or you've never even finished a non-fiction book, you are welcome here. We want a diverse community of like minded individuals. The only requirement is the understanding that each member of this group takes on two roles: both student AND teacher. We all have something to offer and we all have room for improvement... Even you! So join us on this path of self-discovery and self-improvement. You won't regret it!

Kendra

results.description: To all beautiful women of NJ who would like to learn how to walk and live gracefully : ) Every Saturday at 10 a.m. at Ventura Dance Center venturadancecenter.net/dances/belly-dance/ Belly dance as many experts say, is the oldest form of dance, having roots in all ancient cultures. It takes many different forms depending on the country and region, both in costume and dance style. New styles have evolved in western culture as its popularity has spread globally. Belly dance is a low-impact, weight-bearing exercise, osteoporosis preventive and is suitable for all ages and fitness level. The dance is enjoyed and performed by women and men as well. The dance often focuses upon isolating different parts of the body, moving them independently in sensuous patterns, weaving together the entire body. The body benefits from undulating moves that lengthen the spinal column and strengthen the abdominal muscles in a gentle way.
results.name: Ventura DanceCenter 540Durie av Closter NJ (201) 881-6434

results.description:
Are you an English speaker starting a business, working or looking for work in or around NYC? Are you interested in improving your business communication skills? Perhaps you need to improve your Presentation Skills? Meeting Skills? Negotiation Skills? Networking?


If you're truly serious about improving your Business English / Business Communication Skills, this group is for you. There will be various events hosted during the month to effectively improve your business communication skills in the workplace, whether it's your listening, reading, and speaking skills. Once a week for 2 hours, you'll be able to practice english for the purpose of work and receive instant feedback & advice. Building confidence is the key to new levels of success. Looking forward to meeting you at an upcoming event.

Why business English? 
The skills needed to effectively communicate in business are the same skills that'll improve the quality of your work, relationships, and life. 

Focused on improving: 

Listening, Reading, and Speaking 



This group is lead by a native English Speaker and experienced TEFL certified instructor who will guide you to better improve your business english for work. 

OUR REGULAR EVENTS ARE:

Business English Conversations (FREE!) - Every week on Sunday.

Business Book Discussions ($5) - This event is once a month

English Conversation and Vocabulary Intensive for Bankers, Accountants, and Financial Professionals. ($10) - This event is once a month.

If you are interested in an event, but do not see it listed on our calendar, send me an message.


"The best education you can get is investing in yourself." 
- Warren Buffett
____________________________________________________________________________________________ 


BUSINESS ENGLISH CONVERSATION  - (THIS EVENT IS FREE!) 

We'll be using TED Talks, case studies, and various business related articles & topics to improve your listening, reading, and speaking skills. Once a week for 2 hours, you'll be able to practice Business English for work and receive instant feedback & advice.

Materials: TED Talks, case studies, handouts, and business related articles & topics (Will be announced in scheduled meetup)

Time: 1pm - 3pm 

Date: This event is repeated every week.

Place: You can check our Meetup page for the address and directions.

How to find us:  We are easy to locate and meet in visible, public places.  


BUSINESS BOOK DISCUSSION

We'll focus on books written by leading thinkers in Business Strategy, Leadership, Communications, Marketing, and Personal Performance. This meetup will discuss the groups' insights; as well as, ways to implement new skills and strategies into our business careers.

Materials: Will be announced in scheduled meetup.

Price: This event is $5.00.  

Time: 1pm - 3pm

results.description: This is a group for people who want to explore metaphysical issues in Analytical Philosophy. The analytical tradition is distinct from Continental Philosophy in that it is more oriented towards accuracy and precision of language in its arguments. Analytical Philosophy encompasses topics including ontology, philosophy of mind and ethics. This group is primarily focused on Ontology and as such, will explore philosophy of mind and potentially ethics but only from the perspective of what exists. Normative issues and debates are not for this group. We will be primarily concerned with the philosophy of physics, nature and science generally. Issues such as the nature of time and space as well as what makes an object real, continuous and distinct (or not) are all focal points here.

results.description:
Welcome!

Do you wish to be part of a beautiful community of like-minded souls on a personal journey of transformation? Come join us, shine your Light as we focus on our spiritual development, self-healing, joy and self-empowerment from a mental, emotional, physical and spiritual perspective. Our focus will be on energy transmissions, activations and guided meditation. Experience a connection to the higher realms of unconditional love for a journey of spiritual awakening and healing.

About Rachel & Circle of Light U.S.

I experienced much wonderful transformation during Meetups with The London College of Spirituality (LCS) and Circle of Light, London, both as a participant and a volunteer. Now in the US, I miss my spiritual community, the joy and the group energy created when we met. 

I began meditating 15 years ago and was always interested in advancing my spiritual development, completing my Reiki Master attunement in 2009. I trained in Damien Wynne’s Light Grids after experiencing profound shifts related to mind, body and spirit during energy transmissions with Vaz Sriharan from LCS. 

Following a spiritual path, especially if you have recently 'awakened' has the potential to present interesting challenges. Choosing to advance with self-healing usually means working through your life lessons. Being part of a community not only provides support but it can accelerate your spiritual development as you relate with like-minded souls. 

By coming to Circle of Light you are instrumental in creating a group energy. Your commitment to healing through energy work not only impacts on you but on those around you and the planet, as you raise your vibration. I look forward to meeting you, to hear about your journey and to share these beautiful energy transmissions.  


What to expect at the upcoming Meetups 

We hope to provide a beautiful, calm space to be together, meditate, find stillness and joy - or whatever you need right at that moment. We will allow our higher selves and the higher realms, with their unconditional love, to work with us. You may be familiar with Reiki which is purely hands on. Energy transmissions enable us to receive universal energy (Reiki, Divine Light, chi etc) both as a group and individually as it is channelled directly into the space. 

You do not need to have any prior knowledge of meditation and will be guided throughout the experience. 

You always receive exactly what you need for your soul growth at the perfect time. You are never given more than you can handle - despite the fact it does not always feel that way! Love is the key to all existence. Love is also the key to healing all dis-ease. 

Blessings on your journey!
results.name: Circle of Light U.S.

results.description:
Seasonal group since I don't ride under 50 degrees lol Just looking for a group of local riders who may not be able to plan that far ahead because - life happens! So if you free, or want to plan a last minute ride and want the company then put up a meetup. Let's just get out the house and ride. 

Rides can range from 30 minutes to 2 hours+. Personally, after 90 minutes I need a break... this group is open to all motorcycle types such as canam, slingshots, sportbikes, cruisers, etc . If you have a motorcycle endorsement on your VALID license then you can ride with us. Must have valid license and insurance when riding in this group. Group good for folks that don't want to always push 150mph on the highway but okay with a highway range of 60-100mph (depending on traffic/weather) and residential less than 55mph of course. Group good for riders who just want to cruise down the GSP, local roads and take advantage of the weather since it's cold up here more than hot. Face it... we're not in Sunny California. So any day over 60 degrees I'm on my bike, even if it is just to the gym. 

I love riding to Bear mountain... have you been!! Nice easy ride. Looking for others to give ideas and share where they ride to. This is for the general area of North Jersey, Central Jersey, Parts of upstate NY (like Rockland county),  couple NYC rides (if we're brave enough to dodge the pot holes and traffic). Don't want to suck up your whole day, just a couple of hours. I get cold easily so most rides that I plan will be in the early afternoon when the sun is the hottest. Once summer hits and it's over 65 degrees by 7am....  I'm all open to morning rides when the cars aren't out yet. When you plan/host a meetup, you can make it whenever. If you want to do a Waffle house run to Bethlem, PA (45-60 minutes) then let's all go! 

Come to a last minute meet up or host a meetup yourself. Be sure to enable email notification since this group is all about last minutes or check our twitter @njlastminriders. I'll try to post on twitter as the meetups come up... i'm not great with twitter but i'm working on it.

 Let's do this! #Letsride. 

Meetup Dues - Anyone who rides can join and post meetups. Dues are $3 annual. Which is to cover the monthly meetup fees I get hit with. Plus only serious riders who actually ride won't mind the $3 which is less than a tank of gas for your bike.  Don't want to be one of those groups with a bunch of members but only 3-4 people go on rides. Please don't add this group just to be a member. You need to actually participate even if it's only one ride. 


Follow us on twitter for last minute rides that we too lazy to post on meetup lol 

Twitter  @njlastminriders

Facebook  https://www.facebook.com/NJLastMinRiders/

Be safe out there - always!!
results.name: NJ Last Minute Motorcycle Ride Meetup

results.description:
Cashflow 101 & 202 are educational board games, created by Robert Kiyosaki, the author of "Rich Dad, Poor Dad". 

The game teaches accounting, finance, and investing at the same time - yet it does NOT feel at all like classroom learning; it makes learning fun! 

You'll learn: 

- the difference between an asset and a liability; 

- how to make your money work for you (not the other way around); 

- how to get out of the Rat Race and onto the financial FastTrack. 

- You'll be amazed to see how the game reflects how you manage your own finances. 

Bring your family and friends for fun and learning at the same time. If you've never played Cashflow before, you’ll love it! Join us for a relaxed, casual, and fun time! 

We meet on the 3rd Wednesday, every month, at 6:30pm 

We are a group of local Stock Market Investors/Traders, Entrepreneurs & Real Estate Investors. The purpose of this group is to be with like-minded folks as we improve our know-how in the area of Financial Literacy, our Stock Market knowledge, and our Real Estate knowledge... the objective is to help change lives in the real world. 

Please note: CASHFLOW is a registered trademark of CASHFLOW Technologies, Inc. Cash Flow Tribe Cashflow 101 Meetup is not affiliated with CASHFLOW Technologies, Inc. nor The RichDad Company.
results.name: Cash Flow Tribe Cashflow 101 Meetup

Develop and discuss new approaches in relating with someone who has Alzheimer's, and therefore difficulty with these fundamentals which most of us simply assume in our lives. 

There really are peaceful, funny, and tender times for you and someone in your life who lives with this disease, waiting to be discovered.

results.description:
I love when projects are in “development”, because that is often a time about personal development – when we have to get clear on what we believe and what and how we want to communicate to others.   Making a film involves so many skills.  One of the most important skills is being able to communicate your ideas clearly and in an engaging way, whether through your storytelling or through your pitch when trying to raise support to make a film.   This meetup is about providing a place for beginning low/no budget* filmmakers and scriptwriters in the Bushwick/Williamsburg/Ridgewood/Bed-Stuy area to pitch their projects in development and read their short scripts to get feedback and support.  

I taught a Make a Film Class Series at NYC College of Technology’s Continuing Ed for five years, and an introductory scriptwriting class at various locations for over ten years, as well as working and consulting on numerous small guerrilla film shoots.  With my co-organizers, Larry and Adonis who are also working-class low budget filmmakers, we'd like to help establish a community platform to help beginners get beyond themselves and their immediate networks for feedback and support.

(*Low/no budget means $10,000 to $0 cash budget, and scripts 15 pages to 2 pages.)
results.name: Film Project Pitches and Short Script Readings in Bushwick

results.description: Women are forced into tiny boxes by society; told how to dress, how to feel, and what your body should look like. All too often fitness for women is marketed as an 'opportunity' to make yourself smaller and less-than: bikini body everything, toning, endless cardio, diets, and endless other fads and hype are sold to women by telling them they don't fit into the appropriate box unless they do so. To that we say: F-IT! Seriously, eff that! We believe fitness is about more than just looking good. Fitness is about moving well; being able to run, jump, and play; feeling good; and yes, enjoying your body and how it looks. We aim to help you achieve this not by convincing you to make yourself smaller, but to learn to live in your body and revel in all the amazing things it can do! Join us for some fun!

By bringing together professional organizations and facilitating artists, Workshop Days facilitate accessible, cross-discipline arts /activism skill-sharing.

Applied arts disciplines include Community Outreach, Writing to Performance, Museum Education, Forum Theater, Sustainable Arts and Therapeutic Arts. Process Days - BewilderArts Process Days provide space for Teaching Artists to pitch and practice new workshops, as well as propose discussion topics relating to best practice, peer-to-peer support, and personal and professional goal charting.

results.description: Systema builds its foundation on the principles of the physiological systems of the human body. The four major principles of study are Breathing, Relaxation, Structure, and Movement. Instead of teaching various techniques for various situations, Systema focuses on methods that develop movements that are explosive, effortless, spontaneous and unpredictable all while remaining free of excessive tension or emotion- the hallmarks of a true professional. The result is highly efficient, practical martial application that is both unpredictable and explosive. There are no competitions, no belts, no forms to memorize, or traditions to follow. Instead we focus on examining ourselves, the extent of our limitations, and to see how proud and weak we really are. Systema is also known by another name "poznai sebia" or "Know Yourself."
results.name: Systema Martial Arts

results.description:
Exhibitionists who don't know how to draw. Artists curious about exploring public nudity. Gay/Straight. All those who seek a free and encouraging environment to explore the human form. You will learn something. You will make a friend. Come with a mind open to new experiences. This is a safe space.


No cover - Donations greatly appreciated
RSVP - space is limited

1) What IS Naked Drink n Draw? 
*** It's an immersive study in figure drawing while under the influence. In short, you get naked, have some drinks, and draw each other. Sound fun? It is! I will generally start off the night as the first model. After that, we take a volunteer from the pool of artists. We'll continue to take turns as models while everyone else draws. The parlor will be set up for drawing, the work room will be set up for painting, and if enough people are in attendance, the bedroom may be made available for additional drawing space. 


2) I can’t draw... 
*** I can't draw either. It's not about that. Nobody's going to laugh at you if you suck. You could be god awful, but you may find you're better than you think. I can guarantee you won’t be the only shitty artist in the room. Besides, the only way to improve is with practice, and what better way to learn?!

3) Are the drawings judged?
*** There will be a period at the end to critique each others' work, but nobody has to participate. No obligations to share your work. If you are comfortable with your work being photographed, I would like to post it on the group pages.  

4) How much is it? 
*** It’s free! Of course, tips are greatly appreciated for snacks and supplies. It's normally $20 each but, if you can't afford it, we won't let that keep you from participating. it's called "struggling artists" for a reason. 

5) Can I model?
*** You are more than welcome to model. Take turns! Ideally, if we're all naked, we all stand an opportunity as model if we so desire. The only rule I have is you must be nude to pose. That is sort of the point, after all.


6) What do I bring?
*** Bring supplies and booze. I will provide some supplies for those without, but I'm afraid I can not supply free booze. But hey, tip generously and I'll think about it ;P 

7) Can I take photos?
*** Nope. You can draw pictures, but you can’t snap them. Why, you might ask? It's kinda creepy, in a room full of naked strangers, to pull out your camera. Even if you ask, putting one "No" on the spot in a room full of "Yes" is the sort of intimidation and alienation I'm hoping to avoid. Respect this rule, please. Don't be a creep.

8) Who can come?
*** Anyone! with some conditions
-If I do not know you, and we have never spoken, shoot me a message first.
-If you want to bring a guest or three, let me know. 
-If you want to come but not get naked, you better be the life of the party. 


9) Anything else I should know?
***This is a safe space with supportive people and a free and encouraging energy. While people will be naked, don't just assume that's license to read someone's ass like it's brail. Please be respectful, consensual adults. If you start to creep people out, you leave. Also, please be quiet in the stairwell. My neighbors are real sweet people, you guys.

10) Where is it?
*** 297 Ocean ave at Parkside Ave in Brooklyn. Parkside ave Q stop. Three buildings from the subway, on Ocean, across from the park. (1D - Fourth Floor)

11) My boyfriend is not comfortable with me coming to this thing. Is this a sex party? 
*** This is my home. Keep sexpectations to a minimum, and know the line between sex and sexy. We also have couples come to every event. If your significant other is jealous, bring them! That said, if anything grows while you pose, don't sweat it. Appreciate it.

12) How many people will be there? Will it be crowded? 
*** I'm saying maximum capacity is 30. Won't be crowded. 

13) What kind of poses are we doing?
*** ENTIRELY up to you. You can go anywhere from Venus De Milo modesty to spred out and comfy. We're just naked people sketching naked people. For the first few hours we'll be working with short poses. After that we'll move on to longer poses. You can do couple/group long poses or individual 10 minute poses. 
If you have questions feel free to call or text me at 347.409.1220
results.name: Naked Drink N Draw (NDND)

- Photo required.

- NO SHOW to an event without any notification will automatically remove you from the group. 

- Must  have the meetup app on your mobile to connect at meetups. 

- Being late is not a problem. Pls inform the group you'll be late. 

- Rudeness, drama & skipping out on your expenses not acceptable.

results.description:
What if being part of a sisterhood where you are inspired daily to learn from each other and consistently given the tools to succeed from experts made all the difference in your life and your businesses? You’re not alone! What if your best friends were the smartest, sweetest, lady bosses around?  Would they hook you up with their business connections, share tips, knowledge and mastermind with you to help you up-level your business? If that sounds like an answer to prayer, then you my friend, are in the right place.

Lady Savant Society is a sisterhood and a business camp where fabulous lady bosses up-level their skills, connect and build real friendships. Haven’t you ever wanted a safe place to be an unapologetically awesome, winning woman?  We feel like every woman deserves that safe place.

Our mission is to inspire and empower women to turn their businesses and ideas into successful realities by providing a platform for women to learn, connect and collaborate. We are all in this together!  If you thrive off of  surrounding yourself with other like-minded, positive, enterprising  women who are in it to win, then you’re in the right place. CLICK on this video below to learn more:  

https://vimeo.com/154476912

We hope you come try out a "Savanting Circle" and see what the fuss is all about!  What is a Savanting Circle?  Savanting Circles are a safe place to brainstorm, share ideas, ask questions and grow in a group of motivated, trailblazing ladies like yourself.  I promise you will love it!  We are looking forward to meeting you!  

You can find out more about us at www.ladysavant.com and be sure to join our on-line Face Book Business Lounge here:  https://www.facebook.com/groups/LadySavantL...
results.name: Union County Lady Savant Society:A Entrepreneurial Girl Cave

topics.name: spiritual awareness and spiritual awareness events

results.description: Unity of New York is a joyful and vibrant ministry created to celebrate the Truth that all people are created with sacred worth. UNY began in 1999, and quickly grew to become a thriving spiritual community in the Unity Worldwide movement and remains so today in the heart of New York City. Unity of New York is led by spiritual director and music minister, Rev Britt Hall. Unity is a positive path for spiritual living that provides practical teachings to help people live healthy, prosperous and meaningful lives. We honor all paths to God as we provide a philosophy that is spiritual, not religious; and love-based, not fear-based. We strive to help individuals have a stronger connection to God every day by helping them to feel empowered, accepted, loved, inspired and connected. Every follower of Unity principles (sometimes referred to as Truth Student) is free to believe what he or she chooses about God/Spirit and our place in this beautiful and abundant universe. However, there are five concepts that Unity holds to be basic tenets: 1. God is Absolute Good. We don’t believe God is a mean and vindictive man in the sky waiting to punish us for failing. God is found within our very being as Love, Peace, Joy, Wisdom, Light, Life and Perfection Itself. These God qualities are available and accessible to all of us at any moment when we simply go within to where our Creator resides. We believe that there is only One Power and One Presence in the universe and in our lives – God the Good. 2. Since God is Good, then all of us, as God’s creation, must also be good. We do not believe in the concept of Original Sin; we believe that we have been created in Original Blessing. You are God’s wonderful, perfect offspring at this very moment, even if you have forgotten that Truth. God cannot create anything less than Itself. Jesus, our great Teacher and Elder Brother reminded us: “You are gods” (John 10:34). However, to access the fullness of this Truth, we have to awaken to it and become a co-creator with God. 3. We access God’s wholeness, prosperity, peace of mind, and joy by transforming our thoughts, words and actions from negative, limiting, and defeatist, to positive, joyful and optimistic ones. We are responsible for the kind of lives we lead, regardless of what life has been up to this point. When we change our thoughts/beliefs, we change our lives. 4. Through affirmative prayer and meditation, we experience God within us. When we take time during the day to turn everything over to Spirit, we receive exactly the right information needed to make our lives work. We must take time daily in silence for the renewal of our minds, souls and bodies. 5. Knowing these Truths intellectually isn’t enough; we must implement them daily – for the realization of our Oneness with God, and to be a blessing and of service to others. Scripture tells us, “Faith without works is dead.” With joyful enthusiasm we make life a great adventure, and we (and others) are blessed beyond measure by the creative use of these Truth principles.  For more info please chck out our web site at: unityofnewyork.org
results.name: Unity of New York~Spiritual Center Sunday Service

results.description:
Hello Everyone! I am a Registered Dietitian Nutritionist who specializes in Reproductive Wellness and Sports Nutrition. I am creating this group for 2 reasons. 1) To provide a setting in which people can help one another since many of you may have or be walking in the others shoes, as they saying goes, and can offer some insight. 2) I love what I do, and I want to branch out from the traditional office. Although this group may be covering some pretty heavy topics such as infertility, weight issues, PCOS, etc. getting together with a community and sharing a laugh while learning will help to ease stress and we can lift one another up.


The Details:

Location: Either in Los Angeles or in New York City

Meetup Costs: $10 per person.

Costs are part of my services as I can assist with issues pertaining to weight loss/gain/management, etc. This is NOT a 1-on-1 private session, and if you are interested in seeing me for a complete nutritional assessment I will be happy to speak to you about that after a meetup. I see clients in person and on a HIPAA compliant platform :)


Note: You do not have to speak about any of your own issues and you may join just to listen or meet others. However, if you do decide to share you must be understand that this is a casual group setting and not a private setting.
results.name: Reproductive Nutrition On The Go

results.description:
We started our first meetup group in San Francisco back in March 2012.  It now has over 7,500 members (15,000 in all the Bay Area).  With the success of our events, this year we're expanding to the East Coast.

Our goal is to provide a fun low-pressure environment/activity where individuals can connect one-on-one. Sometimes it's intimidating to go to a group activity all by yourself. Or sometimes you get lost in a big group event – you talk to everyone but get to know no one. Wouldn't it be nice to have a date at a fun event?

With our activities, you're welcome to come alone or with a date. And if you need a date, visit our sponsor, HowAboutADate.com. Simply (1) post a date - what, when, & where, (2) review replies, (3) choose your date and go out. Dating Simplified! Do what you love... and love will find you.

Yes, this is a different Meetup group – it combines great activities with (optionally) bringing a date for that activity. We simply want you to have a great time (i.e. enjoy fun dates not "interview dates" or high pressure dates). And feel free to suggest great "first date" activities and even post links to other great meetup events. We're not here to compete with other meetups, only to support and enrich the Singles Community!

There is no age requirement for our group, except that you're over 18 of course. Our members range from 20 to 70 y.o. We're all about making friends first and enjoying the company of others and doing wonderful activities throughout Northern New Jersey (i.e. New York City's Western Suburbs). Cool couples are welcome to attend our great events as well.

Cheers!
results.name: HowAboutADate - North Jersey

results.description:
Yoga Classes @ Cooper Park
Open Level Vinyasa
Mondays, 7:30-8:45am
Dress for weather, bring your mat
￼

For rain or prohibitive weather, classes will be held at:
Trinity Grace Church
231 Ainslie St.
NOTE: Class held at the church on 5/2
￼ Investment:
7 classes (May 2-June 13) $105
Drop-in class $17

About the classes:
Please arrive 5 min before class begins.
We cover a full spectrum of asanas accompanied by precise alignment cues and hands-on assists. Breathwork, mindfulness and meditation complement the physical practice.
Complete beginners and seasoned yoga students can practice side by side, as variations are offered to suit everybody's needs. Please spread the word through your networks!
￼ Teacher Bio:
It began seven years ago as I looked in awe at my friend as she balanced on nothing but her hands. I was from a small, homogeneous town, yoga seemed exotic, and I was competitive. "I need to learn to do that," I thought, and then signed up for my first yoga class. However, what started out as an interest primarily in the physical aspect of yoga (asana) gradually and organically expanded. I noticed yoga seeping into my everyday life, and the results were positive. I taught as an apprentice in Buenos Aires in 2013 and later received 200 hours of training at Jai Yoga Arts, 30 hours at Karma Kids, and continue my studies through daily asana and meditation. I consider my practice to be a 24-hour endeavor, and encourage my students to apply the lessons they learn on the mat to lead more peaceful, aware and joyful lives. In addition to my yoga training, I have studied Rolfing/Structural Integration through international apprenticeship and workshops, and offer sessions privately. In my classes you can expect to be challenged, yet supported with precise anatomical cues and hands-on adjustments.
results.name: Brooklyn Yoga Williamsburg

results.description:
Do you have a shadow life which only exists in your head and maybe on craigslist?  Well, join the club.  This group is a judgment free zone where you can talk freely about relationships, sexuality, fetishes, body image and identity issues, anything really, with a group of people who are there to do the same.

We're all fascinatingly different with regard to the particulars, but very much alike in the way we go through a lot of the same stuff.  Figuring out what we want, how to satisfy that nagging feeling inside and trying to navigate the craziness of craigslist or whatever.

This group will be fueled by honesty, integrity, trust, respect and shared humanity on the part of each participant.  With those qualities in abundance, it can surely be rewarding and a lot of fun.

The content is basically anything goes, but to distinguish this from a sex or fetish party, it will operate as a succession of presentations.  We'll call each one a Presenter.  After getting acquainted and selecting a random ordering of Presenters, one by one each will have the opportunity to address the group and have its full attention.  It may sound a little nerve wracking, and it very well may be, but that goes with the territory.

The job of the participants will be to help each Presenter feel comfortable and supported as they attempt to work out whatever it is they need to work out, even if they don't quite know it themselves.  It is extremely difficult to shed our defenses and be in the world without the safety of the masks we typically wear.  At the same time, not being our true selves wears us down and robs us of living life fully.  Most of us wish we could let our inner selves break free.

That's what this is about.  Important to state, all this nice, touchy, feely talk doesn't mean that the content will be all nice and touchy feely.  Quite the contrary.  Who knows what kind of "crazy" shit we're into?  Sadism or masochism, exhibitionism or voyeurism, other fetishes, compulsive masturbation, we may feel miserable about our physical appearance, feel lonely and isolated, or just maybe a wee bit repressed.  Any kinds of generalizations belie the true diversity of the dynamic individuals we all are and what makes us tick.

Want to come and find out?  Discover yourself in someone else's vastly different journey?  Talk about things you've never been able to reveal to friends and family?  Express things you are so ashamed of you feel the world will come crashing down, only to find acceptance, comradeship and helpful feedback?

Well, then maybe you should be part of this group.

Some people may be sensitive about subjects they consider gross or taboo, so as a participant you're just going to have to know yourself well enough to decide whether this is for you.  Presenters may place themselves in very vulnerable positions, so we will all need to respond with a reasonable balance of honesty and support. 

As a Presenter, you'll be free to go wherever this takes you, but refrain from crossing boundaries that might destroy the ability of the group to function.  No outright hostility toward other participants, for example.

Everyone must agree to treat the things that occur with COMPLETE DISCRETION AND CONFIDENTIALITY. This cannot be over emphasized.  Needless to say, no recording of photography will be permitted.

On the subject of nudity, it is completely acceptable on the part of each Presenter during their presentation.  Not required, but not at all prohibited.  The freedom to be our true selves in the physical sense may play an important role in helping us expand the dynamic range and quality of how we relate to others.  Sure, we'll still have our defense mechanisms there to fall back on, but at least our body language will be just that---body language!  Nudity purely to shock would probably be frowned upon, but as a means of feeling completely accepted as we are, may be vital.

Any form of sexual contact between participants would not be allowed, again to keep this within the bounds of focusing on the individual Presenter and what they are trying to work through.  As far as what is permissible behavior by a Presenter, they should feel free to talk, to move, to express emotion, to disrobe, to touch themselves, dress up however they wish, use sex toys, whatever it is about themselves they want to put out before the group.

This full range of expression is very important.  For example, a Presenter who is troubled by a certain compulsion they continually seek to satisfy without success may gain insights from acting out this compulsion before a supportive group that might not be possible otherwise.  Sort of getting out of your head and into your body and the real world.  Another Presenter may just truly need to feel they are being seen for who they really are.  Each will have to figure out for themselves where to draw the line between self indulgence and self examination.  Reflecting on what takes place, how did it feel, how did other participants react?  These discussions could be very rich indeed.

Meetings would take place in a comfortable private residence in Brooklyn.  All are welcome and a diverse group in terms of age, orientation and gender is hoped for.  Many details still to be ironed out.  Please contact with comments and questions.  Thank you for reading!
results.name: Brooklyn Body Image/Personal Fantasy Support Group

results.description:
Looking for woodwind and brass players interested in getting together to start a HORN CIRCLE!

What is a horn circle? Just like it sounds – it’s basically a drum circle, but for wind players. How does it work? Well, just like a drum circle, there are no formal rules. However, the participants generally approach it with a common understanding of what it’s about …

• All are welcome -- all ages, all skill levels.

• Participants can drift in and out both within a session and from week to week.

• We’re all there because we love music, and we’re seeking a collective, supportive atmosphere that encourages listening and learning from each other rather than competition and cutting.

• Finally, and most important, it’s all about improvisation. There are no arrangements or orchestrations. Nobody leads the session or tries to organize the group to learn tunes in common for the next session. There’s not even any need for talking about how to start when the session begins -- you just show up, join in, and play what you feel ... • 

Now, it does need to be said that horns are very different than drums, and it might not be possible to spontaneously get a coherent sound like they do in a drum circle. If nothing else, maybe we’d need to talk about what and how we’re going to play before starting, right? Well, yes, some talking would facilitate the process – and since there are no rules, there definitely wouldn’t be any rule against approaching it this way. On the other hand, though, an approach based on not discussing anything beforehand might be worth trying precisely because it is more challenging.

Anyway, those types of details can be worked out. At this point, we’re just trying to gauge the level of interest and reach some people who might want to be involved. In terms of logistics, the venue will be somewhere outdoors (still to be determined -- Central Park? Prospect Park? Under the Williamsburg Bridge?) and we’re hoping there are enough people interested so that we can make this happen once per week throughout the Summer.
results.name: NYC Woodwind / Brass Improviser's Circle

Beach Tennis has similar scoring system to regular tennis, 'Love, 15, 30, 40, Game' with no fault nor advantage points, the ball has no bounce in your court before you hit it back to opponent so it's a quicker game then tennis and lots of fun! The court is similar in size to a beach volleyball court, 16m long x 8m wide. There are several volleyball courts in Central Park, including the courts near Sheep Meadow. If you walk toward the east side of the park from Sheep Meadow, you will find two asphalt courts and one sand court. The courts are in the center of the park near 70th Street and adjacent to the Mall. There are also asphalt courts in the center of the park at 86th Street, next to the Great Lawn and the Central Park police precinct. You can find more info, the full rule book and instructional video at the official website of ITF: http://www.itftennis.com/beachtennis/about-beach-tennis/how-to-play

results.description: Are you a writer in search of a writing group. Do you live in Inwood/Northern Manhattan? We are inviting all writers, of all skill levels, to join a newly formed Writer’s Group. We are two writers who need looking to jump start our own practice and want a group that supports the process. Writing can be a very isolating process so we want a community of writers who can help support and stimulate the writing process. This will include guided critiques, open readings of our work, and exploring genres written by authors of color. Writers will be encouraged to share resources, creative influences, along with individual practices. We will meet once a week for eight weeks. Our goals are to expand as writers, create a space for writers of color, allow for safe critique, and stimulate creative growth. Our workshop will focus on the beginning, middle and conclusion of a written piece for future publication and/or sheer pleasure. results.description:
This group is open to anyone looking to make lasting lifestyle changes for a healthier and happier life. I'm based in Livingston, NJ, but anyone in the surrounding area or even from further away is welcome to join.

I'm not a fitness trainer, just a regular guy who reads about the subject and was able to commit myself to a sustainable diet and exercise routine. In just one year, I was able to transform my very overweight body into something much leaner, stronger, and healthier.

It dawned on me that society, as well as the diet and fitness industry, makes healthy living and weight loss seem much harder for people than it really is. With all of the fad diets, expensive supplements, and health myths out there, the average person can hardly be blamed for thinking that healthy living is impossible. It isn't though, and now I want to share my experiences in the hopes of helping others who are looking to make a similar journey.

This group will be easily accessible, with weekend Meetups in cafes and casual eateries where we can all chat in a relaxed setting. There we can share advice on diet, nutrition, sleep, stress management, exercise, or any other health related subject that you may have questions about.

If there's enough interest, I might also expand into group workout sessions at a local park or gym. One step at a time though!

This is an all-inclusive group. It doesn't matter if you're young or old, male or female. Whether you're looking to lose weight, get toned, build strength, look better, or overhaul your health, this group can be the one for you!
results.name: Essex County New Jersey Fitness Group

results.description: This is a group for those who have a love for the paranormal and would like to be a part of a paranormal investigating team. Do you have love the paranormal ? Do you watch countless shows on SYFY, Detestation or Travel channels, or videos on Youtube and say "I wish I was there!" or "I could have done a better job!"? Did the film Ghostbusters inspire your fascination with the paranormal? Do you have a love for film and would like to tackle a new and bold project? There are very few paranormal investigating teams in Brooklyn and I would like to start one. This is also a group for people who enjoy discussing about the paranormal and meeting people who share the same interests. Filmmakers are also welcome (I would also like for us to film our investigations as well) because this is a chance for you to potentially capture something very unique. Whether you are a professional or someone just starting out or a filmmaker looking for a new project to tackle, all are welcome. Ideally we would all meet once a week and plan we will do our investigations and so forth. I would like to go to several haunted locations. The goal of this group is building a team. I would like to not just meet people but hopefully we can all eventually be good friends. I don't care how much experience you have in ghost hunting. I just want to meet people who love the supernatural as much as I do. Hope to see you soon! Happy Haunting!
results.name: Brooklyn Ghost Hunters & Ghost Hunting Meetup

results.description:
Exhibitionists who don't know how to draw. Artists curious about exploring public nudity. Gay/Straight. All those who seek a free and encouraging environment to explore the human form. You will learn something. You will make a friend. Come with a mind open to new experiences. This is a safe space.

No cover - Donations greatly appreciated
All genders welcome
RSVP - space is limited

1) What IS Naked Drink n Draw?
*** It's an immersive study in figure drawing while under the influence. In short, you get naked, have some drinks, and draw each other. Sound fun? It is! I will generally start off the night as the first model. After that, we take a volunteer from the pool of artists. We'll continue to take turns as models while everyone else draws. The parlor will be set up for drawing, the work room will be set up for painting, and if enough people are in attendance, the bedroom may be made available for additional drawing space.


2) I can’t draw...
*** I can't draw either. It's not about that. Nobody's going to laugh at you if you suck. You could be god awful, but you may find you're better than you think. I can guarantee you won’t be the only shitty artist in the room. Besides, the only way to improve is with practice, and what better way to learn?!

3) Are the drawings judged?
*** There will be a period at the end to critique each others' work, but nobody has to participate. No obligations to share your work. If you are comfortable with your work being photographed, I would like to post it on the group pages.

4) How much is it?
*** It’s free! Of course, tips are greatly appreciated for snacks and supplies. It's normally $20 each but, if you can't afford it, we won't let that keep you from participating. it's called "struggling artists" for a reason.

5) Can I model?
*** You are more than welcome to model. Take turns! Ideally, if we're all naked, we all stand an opportunity as model if we so desire. The only rule I have is you must be nude to pose. That is sort of the point, after all.


6) What do I bring?
*** Bring supplies and booze. I will provide some supplies for those without, but I'm afraid I can not supply free booze. But hey, tip generously and I'll think about it ;P

7) Can I take photos?
*** Nope. You can draw pictures, but you can’t snap them. Why, you might ask? It's kinda creepy, in a room full of naked strangers, to pull out your camera. Even if you ask, putting one "No" on the spot in a room full of "Yes" is the sort of intimidation and alienation I'm hoping to avoid. Respect this rule, please. Don't be a creep.

8) Who can come?
*** Anyone! with some conditions
-If I do not know you, and we have never spoken, shoot me a message first.
-If you want to bring a guest or three, let me know.
-If you want to come but not get naked, you better be the life of the party.


9) Anything else I should know?
***This is a safe space with supportive people and a free and encouraging energy. While people will be naked, don't just assume that's license to read someone's ass like it's brail. Please be respectful, consensual adults. If you start to creep people out, you leave. Also, please be quiet in the stairwell. My neighbors are real sweet people, you guys.

10) Where is it?
*** Ocean ave at Parkside Ave in Brooklyn. Parkside ave Q stop. Three buildings from the subway, on Ocean, across from the park.

11) My boyfriend is not comfortable with me coming to this thing. Is this a sex party?
*** This is my home. Keep sexpectations to a minimum, and know the line between sex and sexy. We also have couples come to every event. If your significant other is jealous, bring them! That said, if anything grows while you pose, don't sweat it. Appreciate it.

12) How many people will be there? Will it be crowded?
*** I'm saying maximum capacity is 30. Won't be crowded.

13) What kind of poses are we doing?
*** ENTIRELY up to you. You can go anywhere from Venus De Milo modesty to spred out and comfy. We're just naked people sketching naked people. For the first few hours we'll be working with short poses. After that we'll move on to longer poses. You can do couple/group long poses or individual 10 minute poses.
If you have questions feel free to call or text me at 347.409.1220
results.name: Naked Drink N Draw (NDND) - All Genders!
